Title: BEOGRADSKI ČEVAP
Review: Čevap is focused on the barbecue classics, the one that takes us back to the time when barbecue was a weekly family ritual. The favorite in the menu is, of course, the juicy ćevapi served with chopped onions and kajmak that melts in the hot flatbread. There are also pljeskavice, spicy sausages, and shish kebab, while true gourmets choose tripes or veal kidneys. Top–quality meat is perfectly accompanied with a large selection of fresh salads, and French fries and hot buns complete the pleasure. Wash down each bite with wine from the famous local winery, it can also be ordered by the glass.

OSM.display_name: 73a, Vojislava Ilica, МЗ Врачарско поље, Београд (Звездара), Zvezdara Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11050, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN TROFEJ
Review: Restaurant Trofej is located in the ethnic village of Tiganjica on the road to Zrenjanin, and near tourist attractions such as the village of Belo Blato and Carska Bara. And the ethnic village itself with a small zoo and plenty of farming content will attract the attention of children if you visit the restaurant with your family. What will certainly attract the attention of adults, especially adult gourmets, is the content of the menu in the restaurant itself. Trofej is thematically related to hunting specialties that make up a popular segment of the menu. Starting with – starters, but wild, with a mixture of prosciutto from deer, wild boar, and European fallow deer, to equally wild and yet homemade sausages from European fallow deer and Mangalica, there is wild boar stew as well as a great venison stew with mlinci, baked in wood fired stove. The perfect rolled veal under the sač comes out of from under the fire and embers, there is also the Trofej wild burger, and for the bravest, there is also a couple of versions of grilled series, called voz (train). Since the big fishery Ečka is close by, a good supply of fresh river fish is expected – carp, perch, and trout. With the sounds of tamburica, sipping good homemade rakija in a warm homely atmosphere, we are certain you will enjoy this interesting restaurant.

Title: RESTORAN NA ĆOŠKU
Review: The famous corner of Vračar remembers many iconic catering names of the Belgrade scene and several creative culinary approaches. The interior subtly blends different styles, from classic to modern, making you feel cozy and comfortable just like in a Parisian bistro. The menu is brief and carefully designed to take you on an exciting journey that boldly mixes gastro styles and influences. Start with onion soup. With a bit of cognac and a fine balance of intense aromas of cheese and onion, it is the right way to open the door to the local gastronomic world. Tartare or carpaccio can be the next step, and from the hot appetizers section we recommend the attractive tonkatsu - a great wok fillet prepared with spinach and mushrooms. On a similar note in the main menu, the Japanese calamari with nishiki rice and seasonal vegetables from the wok was excellent. The classic lasagna was excellent, and the chicken tikka took us to another part of Asia, with an equally effective balance of flavors. The selection of steaks and Adriatic fish is a special part of the offer. Recommended dishes are the Irish ale pie, and the Cafe de Paris slice. The staff is discreet and confident in every recommendation. In the sweet section, they are proud of the floating island according to a recipe from 1953, while the warm date cake deserves more than a warm recommendation. A restaurant that will seduce you with its special charm both in the atmosphere and ambience, both on your plate and in your glass.

Title: SALAŠ KOD STARE DUNJE
Review: On the road between Belgrade and Zrenjanin, near Carska bara, there is a farm with a quince orchard and it is one of the best places to spend an afternoon or evening. The hosts will greet you with a warm smile and an authentic, old-fashioned, and homely treatment, reminiscent of some better times, when we were more focused on people and their needs. Gastronomically, the kitchen of Salaš evolves year after year, both in creativity in the choice and the origin of ingredients, as well as in the quality of food and small details in the service. That‘s why this is already a well-established destination for serious gourmets and lovers of homemade Banat specialties, prepared mostly in the ovens and sač are abundantly used. You passthe ovens ay the entrance, and you can immediately smell cooked lamb, veal and top-quality pork. One of the experiences that you willremember is the delicious freshly baked bread with a crunchy crust. Since everything has to make sense in farm life, it is logical that everything possible is produced right there, on the farm. From roasted peppers - for salads, ajvar and pinđur, sauerkraut and pickles, to the pig slaughter feast where masters process the meat into all the products we love so much. A small, hardworking community on this farm is creating its gastronomic story bravely and with a lot of effort. They get better over time, and we are looking forward to witnessing their interesting progress in the years to come.

Title: FILTER
Review: Filter is the place for all breakfast and brunch lovers, especially on weekends. If you start in the morning, eggs are an absolute hit! For those who want the traditional tastes of Serbian cuisine, the menu includes homemade uštipci and gibanica, while the hint of France comes with the French toast, croissants and croque madame. In the category of main dishes, the rich offer includes tuna and steak tartare, lasagna and pasta, stuffed chicken and salmon. For a sweet fiinish, the restaurant offers an irresistible soufflé with rich pistachio cream and ice cream, and the autumn hit is pumpkin souffle with cinnamon cream. In summer, the patio is perfect for a relaxed breakfast and a light start to the day.

OSM.display_name: 10, Кировљева, Михајловац, Београд (Чукарица), Cukarica Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11002, Serbia

Title: SALAŠ VINARIJE ZVONKO BOGDAN BEOGRAD
Review: The Zvonko Bogdan Winery Salaš in Belgrade, located at the very beginning of Beton hala, was designed after the original farmhouse located in the north of Serbia near the Palić Lake. The idea was to bring to the capital the special feelings of enjoying good home– cooked food, wine and an atmosphere filled with the pleasant sounds of tamburica. We can gladly say that they have succeeded. Salaš pays due attention to the food, both by nurturing their verified long–term suppliers and in preparing the ingredients that are combined into some of the most famous Vojvodina specialties. Most of the well– known specialties from the original Salaš are in the menu, and some new ones were specially prepared for Belgrade guests. Vojvodina’s hot gibanica is one of the best cheese pies we’ve ever enjoyed. You will also enjoy the perfectly executed deep–fried peppers stuffed with cheese and gourmet delights such as marinated smoked veal tongue on a tortilla base, and celery salad with eggs. Don’t miss the carrot soup with semolina dumplings! Moving on to the main dishes, we suggest the duck under the sač served on mlinci, or some of the gourmet dishes such as lamb shanks, or spicy pork hooves. Don’t forget that you are at Salaš, a place to relax, the evenings are a real pleasure with the sounds of tamburica from Vojvodina and selected live music.

Title: RESTORAN BSK
Review: Although it is located outside the city, this restaurant has become a favorite gathering place for roast meat lovers of all generations, especially on weekends. The main star of the menu is the pork bayadere, juicy and soft boned meat with a perfectly crispy and salty skin. Trays with roast meat arrive quickly on the table, and with the meat we recommend salads made of fresh or sauerkraut sprinkled with spicy paprika, and roasted chili peppers with garlic, as well as a basket with bread and cornbread, complete a real feast. If there is space left, indulge in the few, but well-selected, desserts. The restaurant is near the lake, so you will definitely enjoy a walk after your meal.

Title: EBISU
Review: Prestigious in every way and in every detail, located on the top floor of the Square Nine Hotel, Ebisu takes you on a unique Asian gastronomic journey. Their high standards are recognized at every step: high– quality ingredients and precise preparation technique, perfect service and effective setting, ideal timing, and discreet courtesy, excellent knowledge of the offer and adequate recommendation. This is followed by a carefully designed wine list and an exciting list of drinks with an accent on Japanese origins. Greetings from the kitchen in the form of a subtle salmon mousse in vinegar and soy sauce herald the sensations. Appetizers are classics of Japanese cuisine, from great gyoza with duck, and tuna tartare, to attractively served spring rolls with prawns. In the tempura section, the soft-shell crab is very special, a refreshing option with seasonal vegetables, followed by sushi in several amazing selections or in the classic form – nigiri, maki, sashimi. For starters there are spicy tom yum, and classic miso soup, udon noodles are excellent in several variations. The aburi selection is unusual, while the teppanyaki segment has aged steak, salmon, and tuna tataki. The selection of desserts is European and captivates with subtle sweet notes. Lucious cardamon with banana jam, vanilla cream, cardamom, and orange, and Grand pleasure with nougat, milk chocolate and hazelnut ice cream. Unique and sophisticated, exciting, and modern, Ebisu is a place that captivates with its ambience and aromas and overall atmosphere.

OSM.display_name: Square Nine, 9, Студентски трг, Косанчићев венац, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN 27
Review: Restoran 27 makes you feel special in every detail. The quiet location in Dedinje has an irresistible garden and several indoor units. The exceptional ambience is harmoniously complemented by cuisine based on quality ingredients and enhanced by creative interplay through a meaningful and harmonious crossing of tastes. An impressive wine list with almost three hundred labels from all the meridians confirms hedonistic orientation. When you add perfect service, staff that discreetly combines experience and youth, all you need to do is to let go. The coconut–prawn soup is an absolute recommendation, and the subtle salad of baby spinach, peaches, beets, and crushed hazelnuts with young goat cheese mousse is one of the favorites on the menu. Tender prawn tartare with avocado and eel sauce continues this streak, and there are also veal fillet tartare and beef cheeks with parsnip puree and white chocolate. The part with pastas and risotto is short and intriguing, such as lavish ravioli with duck and foie gras, and creamy risotto with sea bass. In the meat section, the Toro ribs were excellent as one of the novelties on offer, and on the main stage, look into seafood delicacies, as well as the steaks from Golija beef, and the Mangalica cutlet. The sweet part is an equally stunning addition. Suggestive chocolate Nemesis, gentle semifreddo, New York style cheesecake, and striking lemon tart make the choice sweet and painful. This is truly a special restaurant.

OSM.display_name: 27, Истарска, МЗ Топчидерско брдо-Сењак, Београд (Савски венац), Savski Venac Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11002, Serbia

Title: LEGAT 1903
Review: Legat 1903 is a place where elegant interior design, professional service, and the ultimate pleasure in a carefully selected gastronomic offer meet. Your pleasure starts from the first moment, with the welcome and treatment you receive from the staff, the carefully selected flatware, tableware, decorations, the rich wine list, and a finely designed menu. From the very first bite, while the baked layers of eggplant, pelati tomato and Grana Padano cheese in Parmigiana di melanzane, the jewel of the Italian south, play with your sensations, you will understand what it is all about. Explore further with tuna tartare with avocado, or grilled goose liver in red wine sauce. This sauce gives the note of perfection to the soft and juicy veal fillet with homemade gnocchi and vegetables. They also offer an excellent execution of a dish that often symbolizes the crown of culinary excellence - steak Wellington. The extravagant combination of the taste of beef, mushrooms, prosciutto, mustard, and crispy puff pastry will definitely not leave you indifferent. If you thought that the culinary magic ends there, wait for the conclusions, because the best may be yet to come in the desserts. A refreshing and unusual combination of cubes covered in crunchy white chocolate, filled with Greek yogurt cream and mango jelly, with pineapple sorbet, creamy nougat cake or something else, we leave the choice of the best dessert to you!

Title: GALLO NERO
Review: If you want to feel a touch of authentic Italy in the heart of Belgrade, the Gallo Nero restaurant is the right choice for you. It is located in the center of the city, with a hidden patio and elegant interior with carefully selected furniture and decorations. Be completely spoiled by the gastronomic offer of food and drinks in this restaurant. Start your adventure with light starters, such as aromatized prawns with Taggiasca olives and capers on polenta, or Coquille St Jacques with parmesan and artichokes. One of the creatively designed salads or traditional Italian soups can be your next step of pleasure. For full enjoyment, there are the best pieces of meat and fish such as Angus steak in Barolo red wine sauce with mashed potato and caramelized red onion, veal steak medallions in black truffle sauce with homemade gnocchi, or salmon and asparagus on lemon cream. The premium selection of dishes is accompanied by meticulously selected wines from the Apennine peninsula and a top selection of domestic and foreign spirits. Don’t forget to leave room for dessert and a good espresso, because the pleasure is not complete before you taste the rhapsody of flavors of the pistachio-raspberry cake or the chocolate decadence. For a moment, you will wonder who needs a trip to Italy when its selected flavors can be tasted right at Gallo Nero.

Title: DVA JELENA
Review: The bohemian heart of Belgrade beats in Skadarlija, and it is happiest in the legendary kafana Dva jelena. The menu is a treasure trove of rich traditional appetizers, dishes, barbecue, and delicious treats, all served in generous quantities. The starter has a variety of flavors. They say a little bit of everything, and there is pork and beef prosciutto, prebranac, kajmak, cracklins, young cheese, urnebes salad, cheese pie, cornbread, pickles... A large selection of meat prepared in different ways is offered as main dish, from barbecue to specialties such as Karađorđeva, Hunter’s steak and venison stew. For dessert, continue with local flavors and don‘t miss cherry or apple pie, plum dumplings or vineyard pancakes.

Title: ZA DRUGA
Review: Restaurant Za Druga is a place where you can enjoy food prepared from local products bought from farmers in all parts of Serbia. The menu includes dishes with meat, as well as dishes without gluten and animal products. In the morning, polenta, grandma‘s savory or sweet French toast, and protein white omelet or integral pie are a must. They also offer salad meals that perfectly combine meat, mushrooms, cheese, and grains. Hand–made pasta with chicken or steak is popular, and the offer of classic home–cooked dishes – sarmica, stuffed peppers or peas with meat – changes every day. Before leaving the restaurant, you can buy home–made juices, flour, cheese, and farm fresh eggs.

OSM.display_name: 43, Mackenzie, Крунски венац, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: ENSO
Review: Enso offers high-level gastronomic experiences sits discreetly tucked in, surrounded by the busy roads of the Belgrade municipality of Palilula. At Enso’s, they make even the most demanding culinary wishes come true. When you come in and look at the carefully designed menu, a minimalist style with hints of the Orient hits you, you see a different concept. Dive into the depths of new flavors by opening with fish bone soup with prawn meat and the addition of burnt leek oil, or tom yum soup, prepared in a homemade way. Then, as the most beautiful notes, there are delicacies such as soft carp roe rolled in kunafa dough with vermouth sauce, beef tongue rose with mole sauce, pistachios and pickled onions and a combination of quick-smoked prawns with onion ice cream, cherry and champagne sorbet and crunchy crackers from cuttlefish ink. Main courses such as catfish with sous vide leeks, celery chutney, lemon zest jam and pepper sauce bring the pinnacle of artistic expression. Or, juicy quail combined with goose liver seasoned with java pepper, apple and carrot puree with crispy wheat. If you find it difficult to choose among the sea of sensations, tasting menus with 5, 7 or 10 courses will help. Round off the experience with an interesting dessert such as banana cardamom cake or crunchy caramel.

Title: PAMPOUR BAR
Review: The Pampour wine bar is a place where wine culture is nurtured with passion and dedication. Located on the corner of the streets of Vračar, its space and the garden exude a unique charm. With an impressive list of 600 different labels and a curated selection of wines by the glass, pairing food and drink in this small wine universe is easy to indulge in. The friendly staff are available to help you choose labels that perfectly match your wishes and mood. In addition to the wine offer, the bar also offers a large selection of spirits, cigars, chocolates and gifts for wine lovers, as well as a carefully prepared menu inspired by the flavors of Italy, France and Serbia.

Title: PIZZA BAR
Review: With a view of the monumental St. Sava Temple, this is the perfect place to relax or socialize with good food, especially pizza. Guests can choose between crispy, thin dough, and soft, thick dough. Over twenty pizzas with creative combinations are offered, and we recommend Bianca with carbonara sauce, Siena with artichokes, a sumptuous Truffle Burata and Carpaccio pizza. There are also pizzas with black dough, but also more classic ones such as Quattro formaggi, Pepperoni and Capricciosa. The menu is also rich in sections for breakfast, salads, pasta and risotto, meat and all the way to the irresistible sweets. Choose tiramisu, warm apple crumble or blueberry pie with coffee or wine for a perfect finish of your meal.

OSM.display_name: Pizza Bar Vracar, 5-7, Mutapova, Cubura, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: VINO GRAD
Review: In Vino Grad wine bar you can enjoy a cup of coffee during the day, and in the evening it becomes a central place for drinking top quality wines from a selection of over 100 labels. The wine list is dominated by wines from Serbia, Spain, France, and Portugal. The atmosphere becomes even more exciting on weekends with the excellent selection of funky and disco music. The most interesting place is certainly the bar, where you can talk directly with experienced bartenders and learn more about wines or order your favorite cocktail. If you are indecisive, the friendly staff will help you choose. For a fuller experience, a variety of savory snacks, prosciutto, and cheeses are served with the wines.

Title: PUTER BISTRO
Review: Puter is one of the few places that continuously improves in all important aspects, while successfully maintaining the level of those it has already brought to perfection. Also, Puter is one of only a few restaurants in Belgrade that make with fine bistro cuisine, and practically the only one that is completely oriented towards French specialties. We can say that Puter Bistro is unique on the Serbian hospitality scene. The menu changes seasonally, and the proximity of the Kalenić market ensures top quality food at any time of the year. The offer includes authentic French specialties such as foie gras with smoked veal tongue, rabbit rillette with date gel or pithivier, a traditional French savory pie filled with oxtail in demi-glace. Among the main dishes, you will find veal pressed between layers of potato mille-feuille, served on mushroom carpaccio in a delicate velouté sauce, duck legs with prunes and Brussels sprouts, or quail on mashed potatoes in rosehip sauce. An excellent selection of fish with an original approach to dishes will delight those who love monkfish medallions with collard greens, sardines in sumac tempura, red porgy on cauliflower and anchovy cream with beetroot and apple salad, or shrimp thermidor with white radish and leek salad. This is one of those menus that will keep you coming back to Puter. Of course, everything is in perfect conjunction with extremely charming and professional service, an excellent wine list and an elegant and pleasant atmosphere.

OSM.display_name: 82, Његошева, Cubura, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: CRNA OVCA
Review: Their artisanal ice cream is one of the sweetest pleasures in Belgrade all year round. Crna ovca set themselves apart with unexpected combinations of ingredients, creative flavor choices and a consistent focus on quality. Among the classics are favorites such as vanilla and milk or dark chocolate, domestic and exotic fruits such as raspberry and passion fruit, and the taste of less common combinations – sesame coffee with chocolate coffee beans, white chocolate with strawberries in balsamic vinegar, caramelized white chocolate with salty chocolate beads, or banana with lemon and honey. For the hesitant, the professional and friendly staff will offer a tasting and a recommendation. In addition to excellent ice cream, they also offer chocolate, cookies, and cold white chocolate or milk chocolate drinks.

OSM.display_name: 58, Kralja Petra, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: BISTRO DU VIN
Review: This charming Vračar Bistro is a great place to start your day with a delicious breakfast, or to spend the evening in good company with a glass of wine. Bistro du Vin offers a wide selection on the menu for every part of the day. Choose between omelets, French fries, and savory and sweet croissants before noon. The main dishes include rich salads, interesting pastas with homemade sausages or Saint–Denis with steak, as well as meat dishes. Plates of cheese and meat products inspired by the Mediterranean, or bruschetta with cheese and honey, prosciutto or salmon go well with a glass of fine drink. The street level patio offers a special pleasure during warm summer evenings, when the drink menu is enriched with interesting gin and tonic combinations with herbs and citrus fruits.

Title: POTKOVICA
Review: This old restaurant stands out as a unique gastronomic destination for lovers of horse meat, especially horse steak. Although pared down, the menu has been popular among generations of diners for nearly four decades. The star of the menu is the steak tartare, served with toast, butter, pickles, and onion rings. Steak is also served on a board with fries, sausage, tenderloin, liver, or a combination of grilled meat. The space is small and charming, with authentic rustic decorations that create a warm atmosphere in combination with wood. The staff is known for their kindness and cordiality, both towards regular guests from the neighborhood, and towards guests who come from different parts of the world.

Title: SALON 1905
Review: A visit to Salon 1905 is a luxurious experience that captivates with details of the refined interior. The menu has a tasting menu that can also be vegetarian. At lunchtime, there is a menu option with three courses, and with five or seven courses in the evenings. The spectacular wine list will give your experience a special dimension and, if desired, the possibility of pairing food and wine. Expect a bold and exciting gastronomic journey through Serbian cuisine. Discreet and very friendly staff are there to carefully present each dish, preparation technique and ingredients, and the way of serving leaves an exceptional visual impression. four lovely forms are a greeting from the kitchen–homemade cornbread with pumpkin seed butter, tartare in a cone, jellied pork on zucchini and burek with lamb and red star. The first of the seven famous courses is white corn mush with fried ajvar from Leskovac peppers. It is followed by a reinterpretation of homemade brioche popara with a crunchy uštipak, stew with quail meat and pumpkin panna cotta, and then an imaginative representation in the form of beans with matured kulen espuma and veal sauce. Traditional sarma is transformed to sauerkraut jelly and yoghurt ice cream with an old type of cereal. This is followed by an effective minimalist beef rib eye, with aged garlic and potatoes. The pre–dessert is chamomile, white chocolate powder and raspberry ice cream, and the dessert is so fine on the palate.

Title: ENDORFIN
Review: Defined as a place for local & craft food, Endorfin confidently and skillfully crosses local ingredients and a modern culinary approach. The sidewalk garden is part of the Dorćol chic, while the interior is modernly elegant. The menu opens with small bites, suitable both as an option for larger groups and as an opportunity to try more interesting combinations. We chose a playful palette of flavors – smoked eggplant and caramelized mushrooms on toast, duck confit croquettes with creme fraiche, excellent gravlax salmon on sourdough blinis with pickled onions and roast beef on toast with arugula, and horseradish mousse. Lamb bayadere and Serbian burrata, grilled goat cheese on burek crust, veal tartar with mint, and roasted pepper puree are also part of this introductory magic. Soup with buckwheat noodles and coriander is plentiful and hearty, and in the main part, don’t miss the famous roasted kale with red cabbage puree, which Endorfin was the first to introduce in Belgrade. We also recommend fresh tagliatelle with Mangalica bacon and asparagus. Homemade gnocchi with sage and butter, risotto with Fruška gora mushrooms, chicken drumstick in prokupac sauce, and duck breast with orange cream and beetroot are also attractive. Seasonal tiramisu with raspberries and home–made ladyfingers, and a powerful dark chocolate and hazelnut cake served with vanilla ice cream round off the pleasant atmosphere. Endorphin is undoubtedly a true representative of gastro–style bistronomy.

Title: FRANZ BY TT
Review: Franz by TT is one of a series of lifestyle projects that have sprung up in Belgrade recently. At the core of the concept is a relaxed bistro style for the young and, of course, for those who feel that way. The menu is refreshingly different from what we are used to in Belgrade, and the food is excellent, aesthetically pleasing and, on top of that, unpretentious. The attractive cocktail menu includes interesting combinations of well-known flavors, as well as some non-alcoholic mixes such as lemonade with raspberry and sage, or apricot and almonds. All parts of the menu and beverage menu are very concise and seem to hit the mark. There is a quality breakfast based on pancakes, waffles, but also Shakshouka with spinach leaves, and from the meze selection we recommend fried brie cheese with berry sauce, as well as the Olivier salad. Of the main dishes, you will enjoy wonderfully spicy pasta with prawns, lime and mint, good homemade beef goulash stewed in beer and served on mashed potatoes. We also recommend salmon steak with fennel on orange puree. The selection of wines is very interesting, but also extremely limited. It is worth mentioning that all wines are also available by the glass.

Title: BLOOM
Review: The frequent queues prove that this cute place in the city center is a popular place to start the day and have brunch. Dishes that are designed for the first half of the day dominate – from classic eggs to healthy and exotic choices. Creamy eggs on brioche toast are an absolute hit, and various toppings allow you to adjust the dish to your taste. Avocado toast and hummus with pita bread are the vegan choice. Oatmeal and acai bowls are a favorite if you’re looking for a sweet treat, while bulgur or quinoa salad meals are great for an early lunch. Banana cake and carrot cake are sweet snacks that pair wonderfully with coffee or tea. Bloom also has a large selection of cold–pressed juices and smoothies.

Title: PROLEĆE
Review: Close to Knez Mihailova Street, there is a favorite place for gourmet that testifies to the timeless appeal of Belgrade kafanas. Tables covered with red checkered tablecloths and waiters in white shirts evoke a part of history with a view of the bustle of modern Belgrade. Traditional Serbian cuisine is on the menu, from delicious grilled meat to hearty goulash, as well as homemade broths and cream soups. Each dish is a tribute to flavors and traditions passed down through the generations. Here it is best to try the classics such as ćevapi, pljeskavica and Karađorđe steak. Be prepared for generous portions and complete your enjoyment with a glass of homemade brandy or a refreshing spritzer with soda and Serbian wine.

Title: RESTORAN TRI
Review: After an interesting passage through a building and a garden, a mix of different spaces for enjoyment is discovered, while the music list and details that create retro charm contribute to a good atmosphere. Restaurant Tri is known for its refreshing lemonades of different flavors such as rose and grape, homemade juices that are always available, and an interesting offer of local and regional wines. When it comes to food, there are crispy dough combinations to start with, followed by excellent long-roasted, shredded pork shoulder on celery puree with quail egg, flambéed drumstick on apple puree with tahini, crushed hazelnut and poached pear, or hand-mixed gnocchi and ravioli with different fillings.

Title: THE SQUARE
Review: Since its opening, the Square Nine hotel and its restaurants have raised the bar in every hospitality segment. A visit to The Square restaurant is a hedonistic feast in every detail, sip, and bite. David Šimunić, the new chef, presented an imaginative author’s menu based on local heritage excitingly crossed with modern trends. Greetings from the kitchen come as a cute scone with crackers and cream, and a delicious scone with butter. The Olivier salad arrives in its deconstructed version, consisting of bars and purees of basic ingredients such as carrots and peas. Next is a great kavurma with brioche, dried apricots, and a kajmak–based dressing, accompanied by a lucid savoury shiso leaf in tempura. The questioning of tradition continues through two magical versions of burek – with cow’s cheese and kajmak, and with Buša meat, foie gras and grated truffles. All this, and more, is part of the unique Experience menu. On the regular menu are Square classics, ranging from Bolognese to steak tartare to burgers. The gastronomic journey through the landscapes of the modernized and shifted Balkan cuisine continues with perfect lamb meat served in a rich sauce based on white chocolate, apple, pear and tonka beans, effectively accompanied by a roll on sauerkraut. Gin and pear sorbet will prepare your palate for the sweet part with a famous selection of European stars. Mille feulle, and especially Pain perdu get only flattering marks for the magical mix of aromas and textures.

Title: PRIME
Review: Retaining the best elements of the iconic design of the previous venues that were located in this corner of the iconic Belgrade hotel, which changed its appearance throughout history but alwaysretained its charm, this restaurant also artistically exudes the charm of that timeless, classy Belgrade spirit. Whether you prefer to whet your appetite with rakija, a cocktail or a glass of sparkling wine, the selection and quality here will really please you. The cuisine is a combination of the best local specialties and the classics of European gastronomy. For example, for an appetizer, you can order an excellent tuna tartare with avocado cream and fresh mango, where several layers of flavors come together in a very unexpected way, or mini peppers with cheeses from Šumadija. A classic of every good local tavern, fried pepper stuffed with cheese, in this case it is a conscious choice of the best ingredients paired in an adequate way. Among the pastas, we highlight homemade pljukanci with fresh truffles, or homemade gnocchi stuffed with shrimp and dried tomatoes as a successful experiment based on European cuisine. Then we come to the Queen, Her Majesty the Prime pljeskavica. Juicy, with the ideal amount of onion in the composition, served with fantastic kajmak and unexpected sweet potato puree. They also offer Wagyu steak as well as fish specialties and Adriatic shrimp. If after generous portions there is still room for dessert, do not miss the pistachio and raspberry cake.

Title: RESTORAN GILDA
Review: Prestigious, refined, and classy, Gilda is a place to taste a modern vision of traditional Italian cuisine. In a wonderful old building from 1926, just below the Karađorđe Park, with a modern interior and an elegant design, Gilda has a brief menu with a representative selection of precisely executed dishes in which the sumptuous aroma of quality ingredients comes to the fore. It opens with a selection of exceptional Damini delicacies, as well as attractive marinated fish carpaccio, authentic vitello tonnato and excellent burrata with caramelized tomatoes. Quality olive oil and a great selection of pastries are the perfect accompaniment, while the playful fritto misto selection with onion and garlic mayonnaise transports you directly to Italy. Among the pastas, fresh fettuccine with homemade sausage and broccoli will catch your attention, and we were completely won over by the subtle ravioli with mushrooms, great artisan cheeses, sprinkled with hazelnuts. The veal tagliata lavishly demonstrated a knowledgeable approach to the selection and preparation of meat, and the selection of cutlets and ribbed Rubia steak are the inspiration for this section of the menu. On the other hand, there is a good selection of Adriatic fish, as well as grilled octopus and shrimp. The service is professional and discreet. Original tiramisu, effective crème brûlée, and chocolate fondant consistently close the hedonistic circle that finely combines the charm of the Mediterranean and the taste of Belgrade.

Title: JB PIVNICA
Review: Classic Serbian cuisine is the center of attention in this family pub, and dishes such as grilled meat, juicy ćevapi and pljeskavice, Karađorđe and Vienna schnitzel dominate the menu. For starters, classics like cheese and kajmak share space with pork aspic and special delicacies like fried goose liver. Traditional tastes dominate in soups and cooked dishes such as sarma and boiled beef, while the Pirot steak with the famous cheese, bacon and pork crépine or the juicy pljeskavica with cheese and bacon stand out as favorites. With hot buns, rich side dishes, ajvar, chili peppers or sauerkraut, you will enjoy the food and pleasant atmosphere. With a glass of good local wine or beer, of course.

Title: KAFANA KALENIĆ
Review: Kafana Kalenić is an authentic corner of tradition near Kalenić, one of the most picturesque markets in Belgrade. The special atmosphere still reflects the old pulse of the city felt by visitors of all generations. It is a special pleasure to drink your morning coffee here with a glass of good rakija and read the papers – old school. The menu includes rich appetizers – cheeses, homemade kajmak, cornbread and ajvar are just some of the specialties. The daily offer of main courses are cooked dishes, such as stuffed peppers, sarma or goulash, and for lovers of barbecue and meat, there are juicy ćevapi and pljeskavice or the famous Karađorđeva steak.

Title: SRPSKA KAFANA
Review: Srpska kafana is a place where bohemian stories of old Belgrade are preserved. Here, the gastronomic journey starts with a glass of homemade rakija and a rich meze, and it continues with the homemade veal soup. There are also classics from the grill, pljeskavica, ćevapi, homemade sausages, skewers and fillets, which is a winning combination with a well-seasoned salad and a hot bun. Karađorđe schnitzel, Wiener schnitzel or pork cutlet are some of the classics on the menu, while beans are a must in kafana at winter. Pancakes, sour cherry pie or walnut meringue are delicacies that go perfectly with brewed coffee, and the old-school staff will make you feel like a welcome guest every time.

Title: BUDDHA-BAR
Review: Positioned in the central part of the modern residential and business complex Belgrade Waterfront, the Buddha Bar restaurant exudes the mystique and exoticism of the Far East. The impressive interior is decorated with a large statue of the golden Buddha, and the striking design of the space continues in the pleasant garden. A carefully designed menu opens the door to unusual tastes and combinations that will surely be a pleasant surprise. There are specialties such as spicy tuna tiradito with a mix of togarashi sauces, jalapeño and yuzu truffle ponzu, fried squid with a sweet-spicy dressing and notes of chili pepper and mint, or summer truffle chicken gyoza with shiitake mushrooms and teriyaki sauce. In the soup section, traditional tom yam soup with fine pieces of shrimp, squid and mushroom or exotic ramen soup with coconut milk awaits you. Lovers of vegetarian specialties will have a wide choice here - from avocado sushi rolls to quinoa salad, to fried tofu with black bean sauce. Of the main dishes, don’t miss the juicy steak from the wok or the provocative homemade red curry pork ribs. There’s also five-spice BBQ chicken. Don’t skip various sushi creations, such as crispy crabs or spicy tuna rolls, are also an unavoidable part. To spice up the concept of the offer, there is also a rich selection of steaks with a range of sauces. The sweet corner offers excellent bayadere with praline and sesame, or coconut raspberry cake.

Title: KAFANA „?“
Review: This is the oldest kafana in Belgrade, with a century old tradition. The outdoor part has a view of the Serbian Orthodox cathedral, and the interior reflects the spirit of old times. The menu includes traditional specialties such as prebranac and stuffed peppers, juicy ćevapi and pljeskavice, and there are also dishes with the famous Serbian fermented cabbage, from Sarmi to stewed sauerkraut. Fresh homemade buns are an additional delight, which go perfectly with kajmak. You can have a homemade rakija as aperitif, and finish with traditionally brewed coffee that goes well with traditional sweets such as orasnice, pies or dumplings. The rustic interior with low wooden tables contributes to the authentic experience of a real Serbian kafana.

Title: SMOKVICA
Review: The interior of Smokvica is in the style of a living room somewhere in Provence, while the garden is under the canopy of a fig tree. A special item on the menu is breakfast – oriental, country, or Italian, and there are also French fries and shakshuka. The menu combines the flavors of the Mediterranean and international cuisine, and there is a sharing menu so the guest can try more options - you can try focaccia, hummus, skordhalia – a garlicky potato spread, zucchini fritters, beetroot carpaccio, agnolotti pasta with pumpkin, taquitos, and veal tonnato. The rich offer is completed by Neapolitan pizza, salad meal, risotto, and burgers. Desserts are a continuation of the journey through the flavors of the world – hazelnut souffle, creamy cheesecake, tarte tatin, brownies with Belgian chocolate.

Title: ĆEVAPLIJA
Review: Under the slogan – let‘s eat first, and then everything else – Ćevaplija is Belgrade‘s Mecca for lovers of one of the most delicious Balkan specialties. Near the Palilula market, it celebrates all forms of ćevapi in a folk–bistro concept. Ćevapi from different regions – Niš, Užice, Banja Luka and Leskovac, to special categories in which the elephant‘s ear burger, pillows on cream... From the grill there is also drumstick on skewers, pork chops, skewers, sausages – an all-star team. They also have a section with comfort food, and an excellent selection of side dishes and appetizers. The wine list contains select wines and enhances the experience of dining in Ćevaplija.

Title: FRANŠ
Review: Everything is said when you say Franš. An indispensable name on the gastronomic map of the capital is remembered for the harmoniously arranged garden, interesting quotes and wine showcases in the interior, as well as for the well-coordinated team of discreet and cordial waiters. Franš is a frequent choice for celebrations, so be sure to make a reservation, regardless of the time of day or year. The extensive menu skillfully and harmoniously combines national and international, traditional, and contemporary, in dishes that adhere to high standards in every respect. A selection of local delicacies is a logical choice to start with, as well as very nice homemade pies. As soon as you settle down, a selection of hot pastries and an interesting couvert arrives on the table, which includes a serious selection of olive oils and spices. Ask what seasonal potages they have, and an unusual mix of celery, beetroot and prunes was excellent. Furthermore, listen to the recommendations of the friendly waiters. In addition to the rich meat menu, on which we highlight the juicy Franš packages, there is also an excellent selection of fish, while generous and creamy pastas are especially highlighted. One section is dedicated to truffle dishes, and there is also a lean, vegetarian section. The list of desserts is separated in the electronic edition of the menu and offers an irresistible choice - from tulumba filled with vanilla ice cream, over sumptuous cakes like Remy Martin or cake with fresh raspberries, tiramisu, and crème brulee, to a great trilogy of chocolate mousses and pancakes in multiple versions. It is the right choice for many people and is the first choice for all occasions.

Title: SAŠA BAR
Review: This extremely interesting combination of French bistro and Italian restaurant is located in one of the old pre–war villas in the heart of the old part of the city, Belgrade‘s upper Dorćol. This urban bar with a minimalist concept is popular for cocktails and a light dinner after work or with friends. A great selection of food and drinks awaits you in an ambience of refined elegance. The concept was born from the rich experience of the owner of the restaurant, previously involved in numerous successful gastronomic projects in the Serbian capital, and here it got its full glory and is surely stepping into the waters of high–class and quality hospitality. A carefully created menu, which seasonally follows the best tastes and presents them in selected delicacies, will certainly not leave you indifferent. The cold dish offers bold options such as tuna tartare, chicken pate with pear in wine sauce, goose liver terrine or prawn carpaccio. If you want to play it safe, there are the stars of the restaurant – boned chicken from the oven, lamb legs with mashed potatoes and spinach, an exceptional piadina with homemade ham or one of the delicious pastas or risottos. The enjoyment will be rounded off by desserts such as homemade bayadere or original tiramisu. The best tastes are accompanied by over one hundred well–chosen labels of the best domestic and foreign wines.

Title: RESTORAN CORSO
Review: Whether it‘s hot summer months when you can enjoy on the large patio adorned with olive trees and wooden details, or the cooler weather when you sit in the warmth of the bar gently swaying on the river, the Corso raft is definitely a place to enjoy on the Novi Beograd quay. A wide selection of wine labels, which are available in an impressive number by the glass, cocktails, domestic and international spirits, as well as excellent mixes of squeezed juices, will be pleasant if you stop by for a break after a walk or bike ride. If you are in the mood for a light lunch, there is a wide selection of sushi rolls, salads and sandwiches. Thinly sliced tender pieces of steak in a crispy crust, topped with a simple, delicious pumpkin seed sauce, make an excellent warm appetizer. Chicken pate and Lyon quenelle are highly recommended. For lovers of the classics with a little twist, there is also sweet foie gras with strawberry jam. Then a series of pastas starts, among which we would single out osso bucco Bolognese, an interesting innovation of the classic, and spaghetti served with slow–cooked beef shank and bone marrow in a creamy red sauce. For gourmets, there is the must–have pulled pork, shank with mlinci, burgers and veal in kajmak sauce, which is truly the trademark of this restaurant. In addition to sushi, fish specialties include salmon, tuna and perch. For dessert, we tried an excellent cake made of four types of Belgian chocolate, with a creative name – 4d cake!

Title: FERDINAND KNEDLE
Review: Ferdinand in Zemun is a dumpling kingdom. The traditional Serbian dessert was reinvented here with innovative savoury and sweet combinations. In addition to the classic fruit fillings with plums and apricots, there is a large selection of unique combinations – from domestic and exotic fruits to chocolate, caramel and coconut combinations. The queen of local dumplings is the decadent Queen Mary, with perfectly combined flavors of walnut cream, walnut kernels, cocoa, caramelized walnuts, roasted hazelnuts and almonds, followed by the Princess from Madagascar, in which combines silky vanilla cream with white chocolate, mascarpone and biscuit. Interesting aromas and textures dominate among the savory flavors as well. The selection of hot chocolates on a stick is also unique.

Title: KAFANA SUVOBOR
Review: Kafana Suvobor has preserved the spirit and flavors of old Belgrade. Traditional checkered tablecloths and dark wood tones create an atmosphere for enjoying authentic Serbian cuisine. Homemade gibanica is prepared to order, and it‘s worth waiting for half an hour, as it is the breakfast star! It arrives on the table hot, fragrant, and crispy. For starters, Suvobor offers shredded cracklings, cornbread, kajmak, cheese and deep-fried peppers stuffed with cheese. The main dishes are kafana classics, from grilled meat to a wide selection of cooked dishes - goulash, sarma, moussaka or a rich portion of baked mlinci with smoked pork shank. Finally, along with brewed coffee, sweets remain true to tradition - srneća leđa, urmašica or apple pie close the gastronomic circle of Suvobor.

Title: PIZZA FABRIKA
Review: In Fabrika at the new address, the powerful pizza oven is constantly working. Whether you‘re a fan of classic combinations or if you like to explore new flavors, there are over twenty combinations on offer here in three different sizes, each with a crunchy rim, soft center, and juicy ingredients. Various fillings, cheeses, cured meat, fresh vegetables and aromatic spices are used, which make each pizza special. From the classics, there is Margherita, Pepperoni and Capricciosa, options with spicy sausage or Pizza House Fabrika - with mozzarella, gorgonzola and Tyrolean speck, and Cheese pizza with as many as six different types of cheese. In addition to pizzas, they also offer focaccia and pizza bread sandwiches.

Title: PRANA BRUNCH&MORE
Review: Prana sets the standard when it comes to healthy eating and variety of flavors. Ideal for breakfast, brunch or light meals, this venue offers a wide range of options including vegan, vegetarian, and gluten- free flavors. You can also create your own flavors by combining vegetables, fruit, seeds, nuts, and different protein sources. The menu offers a variety of options, from crispy avocado and salmon toast to quinoa salad, protein omelet, gluten-free pasta or risotto, and healthy options like a poke bowl with tofu or spicy chicken. From the rich selection of desserts, we highlight carrot cake, banana bread, raw cakes, and interesting sweet gnocchi.

Title: LANGOUSTE
Review: There is a long list of adjectives that can be used to describe the unique gastronomic experience at the Langouste restaurant, which has become a modern fine dining restaurant where the local and the global are boldly questioned and crossed. A luxurious wine list and a list of premium alcoholic beverages harmoniously accompany the unique culinary creations. We recommend one of the tasting menus - meat, fish or a menu that combines the best of both selections, and there is also an À la carte selection. From greetings from the kitchen, through exceptional sourdough bread, to dessert, each plate is a small work of art, precisely executed, visually effective, and sensational on the palate. The magic starts with homemade pastries with truffle- flavored butter, followed by crust cones with shiitake mushroom and Parmesan filling, mushroom cream and beer hop foam creatively served in an eggshell. The rhapsody of flavors continues with tender, seasonal potages, and powerful pheasant consommé with floating chicken liver pâté. Then, on the one hand, a subtle smoked greater amberjack tartare served on a refreshing cucumber and celery jelly, and on the other, an intense crispy pie with truffles and Pirot cheese. The feast of gastronomy continues with desserts. Green tea frothy cream with crumbled fermented fig leaf and coconut ice cream are there to coat the palate, and then they are won over by Paris–Brest with hazelnut cream and ice cream from caramelized kajmak.Exceptional!

OSM.display_name: University of Arts in Belgrade, 29, Kosančićev Venac, Косанчићев венац, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: BARREL HOUSE
Review: Barrel House, a space with a modern minimalist design, often hosts various events, so be sure to check availability. In the evenings, the experience is rounded off by live music, and their inspiring menu provides enough reasons to explore and pair tastes, starting from creative cocktails to predominantly Serbian wines on the wine list. Warming up comes with sharing plates, walnuts that give a seductive note to rolled plums, and apricots paired with pistachios, while magical nuances are introduced by the famous gyoza. As a starter, salmon is served in gravlax or tartar option, there is also baked burrata and falafel, black risotto, and gnocchi with Mangalica meat. Modern national grilled meat is represented by pljeskavica with Miroč cheese, and on the other hand, baked tripe, goulash with gnocchi and kajmak, and veal head in tripes, baked with Parmesan cheese. We tried an interesting dish, liver stuffed with red onion jam, prunes, and hazelnuts, on carrot and apple puree and mighty aged roast beef in an intense sauce with four types of peppercorns. Flambéed beef neck, rolled duck, rolled sea bass, pork belly, and pig cheeks sous vide, are equally captivating with their modern execution and presentation, and the friendly staff knows what to recommend. Finally, the deconstructed Vanilla slice with raspberry liqueur reduction, served in a wine glass, along with baked delicate lime cheesecake, topped with homemade blueberry jam, are just a confirmation of the playfulness in every segment of the menu, the beverage menu, and the entire concept.

Title: RESTORAN PAVILION
Review: One of the more interesting boutique hotels in the heart of Belgrade can boast a restaurant with a modern and urban concept as part of its offer. During the day, the atmosphere is intended for city meetings, business lunches or moments when you just want to enjoy the peace, and the evenings are dedicated to good times, nights out to be pampered by the professional staff of the bar with an excellent offer of cocktails, and music for a good atmosphere. Although the kitchen is oriented towards a quality bistro offer in terms of ingredients, preparation techniques, gentle fusion of elements of world cuisines as well as presentation, it remains simplified enough to nicely round off the needs of the hotel as well as the concept of the restaurant itself. Everything we tried was extremely tasty, beautifully presented and served with a smile. An excellent wine list as well as the bar offer are one of Pavillion’s strengths. On the menu, in addition to several excellent vegetarian and vegan options, you will find most of the specialties from the bistronomic all stars team - duck fillet, lamb shank, beef cheeks or osso bucco, which we welcome as gourmets and lovers of this selection. It seems that there is a growing trend of using demiglace in more places on the menu, which we noticed here as well. In the announcement of the new menu, they have the opportunity to surprise the guests with a new interesting sauce.

Title: CASA NOVA
Review: This Casa Nova restaurant in Dorćol tempts with a seductive combination of Italian and French cuisine. As soon as you step into the romantic ambiance of the restaurant with many hidden corners,you will be greeted by friendly staff who are here to fulfill your wishes. The menu itself is structured in two sections. The first section is simply called Light, and here you will find a variety of appetizers such as juicy parmigiana di melanzane or rolled mozzarella with pesto sauce, and you will also find the soups you shouldn’t skip, such as the tomato soup with pistachios or stracciatella, or clear chicken soup with dumplings made of Parmesan and parsley. Light bites also include selected fish, like fresh salmon with asparagus or smoked trout, a salad meal or salad with a meal. You must not skip one of the great risottos - with truffles, shrimp, vegetables, or homemade pasta where you choose one of the six pasta options offered. The second section is called Fine Menu, and it offers various meat options. We recommend duck in berry sauce or turkey in gorgonzola sauce. The steaks are simply an explosion of taste in this menu section. Whether it‘s a steak served on arugula, with porcini mushrooms or in a spicy cognac and pine nut sauce, green pepper or maybe red wine and raisins, you should try one. Round off your experience with a lemon tart or a chocolate mousse. From the good selection of wines by the glass, choose one to pair with the dessert as well.

Title: RESTORAN VUK
Review: If a restaurant has guests who have been coming regularly for decades through several generations, from visits with their parents when they were children to coming with their children or grandchildren, that venue is my definition of a seriously iconic restaurant. Vuk certainly is, and today it is a favorite place for dining, conversations, and business meetings for a wide variety of audiences. In accordance with its slogan, “If you haven’t been to Vuk, then you haven’t been to Belgrade”, it is still a place visited by many tourists and visitors passing through Belgrade. This is partly due to the excellent location in the downtown pedestrian area, with two beautiful patios on two streets, and partly to the sense of history and tradition that lives in every plate served. Their classics, such as veal schnitzel, veal pilaf, stuffed peppers, or garden patience rolls, are made lavishly, honestly and from high quality ingredients, and above all, standardized by vast experience. The old, experienced waiters will pamper you with the top service that you expect in this type of restaurant and that many of us love and appreciate. Don’t forget to enjoy the people sitting next to you because it seems like every table has its own story to tell, and at the same time it’s as if they are all united by a secret. I guess that’s the secret of such places with a special character.

Title: DUŠANOVAČKI CVET
Review: For a long time, this restaurant has been a favorite place for lovers of local Serbian cuisine. Every meal is a real feast because the food comes in generous portions, from starters to desserts. Selected dried meat products and cheeses as a classic Serbian snack or fried stuffed peppers are among the cold and hot appetizers. The main dishes are dominated by grilled meat, but also veal and potatoes under the sač, prepared in clay pots covered with charcoal. Pork bayadere are a must! Along with a wide selection of refreshing seasonal salads, the aroma of hot homemade buns is captivating, and the meal is nicely rounded off by classic and seasonal delicacies.

Title: ORGANSKI PODRUM
Review: This place celebrates wines that bear the seal of organic cultivation – wines from local producers, as well as regional and world wines. The richness of the offer is reflected in over a hundred different labels, red, white, rose, amber, dessert and sparkling wines. Every week, the selection of domestic and foreign organic wines that are available by the glass and accompanied by fine snacks that accompany the wine‘s notes changes. Visits of famous winemakers and wine tastings are regularly organized, which gives visitors the opportunity to dive deeper into this world. Evening tastings are accompanied by the sounds of jazz as part of the Jazz & Natural Wine Session evenings.

Title: RESTORAN DEDINJE
Review: The trail of luxury, good tastes and gourmet sensations leads us to the prestigious Belgrade landscape of Dedinje, where the restaurant of the same name is located. Refined ambience with a luxurious aquarium in the middle immediately tells us that we are in a place that is different, special. Friendly and accommodating hosts who welcome guests with a wide smile only reaffirm the impression of uniqueness. The menu and carefully selected wine list open wide the door to complete enjoyment. Whet your appetite with gourmet delights like baked goat cheese with light homemade fig jam or a steak roll in a delicate pumpkin seed sauce. Tease your palate further with a great selection of risottos, with chicken and peppers, prawns and saffron, or with mushrooms. A great selection of meat and fish from the Josper oven is not to be skipped, and the only question is what to choose between irresistible pieces of steak in olive oil that melt with every bite, tomahawk or black–angus steak, and salmon or tuna. For lighter meals, there are creatively designed salads, salad with grilled prawns and quinoa, or salad with steak and cranberry balsamic vinegar. Complete a perfect meal with a sweet treat – chocolate souffle, homemade cheesecake, or a sweet and sour apple cake that pairs well with vanilla ice cream.

Title: RESTORAN DIMITRIJE
Review: With the garden harmoniously connected to the modern and elegantly designed space with a view of the open kitchen, you get the pleasant feeling that an excellent gastronomic atmosphere awaits you. Showcases with steaks and cheeses and a wine shelf also contribute to this. Experienced and discreet staff are here to recommend and help you choose in every part of the menu. The impressive selection of meat should be particularly emphasized. The very beginning hints at lavish flavors: creamy celery potage, great mushrooms stuffed with gorgonzola and red onion, attractive lamb meat pie, duck liver, goose pâté, powerful steak tartare. You won’t often see Cacio e Pepe pasta on Serbian menus, so we recommend that you taste it here, it’s excellent. Do not miss the opportunity to try the pizzas. The rich selection of meat in the display case and ripening chamber is tempting. Along with serious pieces of meat, you choose your own side dishes and sauces, which are expertly prepared in the Mibrasa charcoal oven and strikingly served in front of the guests. Ranging from T–bone, rib eye and medallion, to juicy lamb chops, pork ribs and unusual sausages with jalapeño peppers, all the way to Wagya and Black Angus steaks, you will have a completely unique experience rounded off by a wine list with more than 120 labels. Be sure to save room for dessert as well. An original tiramisu or a lean cake with apricots confirm that in Dimitrije, they pay attention to every dish and every detail.

Title: RESTORAN PAŠA
Review: Located on Zemun quay, Paša is one of those restaurants where everything is good. The view of the wide Danube is priceless, regardless of whether you are sitting on the terrace or in the cozy interior. Everything on the small, but obviously carefully designed menu is delicious– both river and sea fish, as well as meat specialties and everything from the grill. The first dish is the inevitable spicy and rich fish broth, followed immediately by bruschetta with rolled goat cheese or with vegetables in a pesto dressing. Turkey with mlinci is the highlight of the offer, just note that it arrives in a portion for two, and it is enough for three or four hungry persons. It takes a while to prepare, but it is worth the wait. On the meat side of the menu, there is excellent barbecue, and our favorite is Deda Ćira’s pljeskavica, followed by homemade sausages and pork fillet in a bacon crust, but also T–bone steak, filet mignon, and beef chop. If you want seafood flavors on the river, Paša Plata is an excellent choice, with a mix of grilled octopus legs, mussels, shrimp and squid, and seafood risotto served in the middle of the table. The Danube story is presented by the Paša plate on which perch, carp and trout are served. You can order each one of these as a separate dish, and we draw your attention to trout fillets in caper and almond sauce, or sea bream in lime and dill sauce. Finally, the apple cake is a must.

Title: BURGER HOUSE BROS
Review: The story of the brothers who brought the taste of burgers from America continues to develop. The core of the gastronomic experience is the beef, which is roasted so that the center is juicy and full of flavor. From the standard burger with cheddar cheese, to the local burger with Serbian Miroč cheese, perfect for grilling, there is also the Double smash burger and the youngest, decadent Truffle Bro with truffle. It has truffle and hazelnut oil, truffle carpaccio, plus truffle sauce. If you want to step out of the burger section, we recommend the crispy chicken, or the veggie cheeseburger. Homemade or sweet potatoes, crispy onion rings or fried mozzarella are the perfect accompaniment.

Title: GO SUSHI
Review: At six locations across the city, Go Sushi offers the flavors of Asia, from warm miso soup, colorful appetizers, to sushi or meal bowls. Try delicious gyoza, crispy spring rolls or soft bao buns with chicken or bacon. The sushi selection is truly amazing. There are classic maki rolls, California rolls and the must–have nigiri, all with carefully selected ingredients. To make sure you try a little bit of everything, there are meals that combine different rolls, from 16 to as many as 56 pieces. They also make crispy chicken in Japanese curry or with noodles, as well as chirashi and poke bowls with fresh ingredients. Japanese beer or teas go well with the flavors of Asia.

Title: RAI URBAN VEGE
Review: Rai Urban Vege is a paradise for lovers of vegetarian and vegan cuisine. The menu reflects their dedication to preparing carefully designed dishes and coordinated combinations of ingredients – from the Fit category where the most popular are spring rolls in rice paper, Buddha and Super bowls. In the Urban category, there are burgers, spanakopita, quesadilla and vegan gyros or falafel. The variety continues in the gourmet section through specialties inspired by international cuisines – Asian cauliflower, royal lasagna with vege bolognese sauce, chili, enchiladas, and exceptional desserts. The friendly staff will advise you on choosing both the food and a specially created offer of local wine.

Title: STARA HERCEGOVINA
Review: The specialty of this favorite restaurant is traditional dishes. For starters, cold and hot appetizers such as peppers stuffed with cheese, prebranac, corn bread or pihtije and breaded tripes, dishes that always raise long discussions. Cheese and prosciutto go perfectly with homemade rakija as appetizers. A rich selection of cooked dishes preserves the spirit of the kafana specialties – from juicy ham hock, long cooked sauerkraut, veal head in tripes, to tripes in sauce. There are also great dishes from the grill, Leskovac stew, grilled veal brisket, sausages, pljeskavica, and ćevapčići. The sweet end of the meal is also rooted in tradition, so in Old Herzegovina the meal ends with tufahija, urmašica or plum pie.

Title: LORENZO & KAKALAMBA
Review: Lorenzo i Kakalamba is a very special sensory experience indeed. From the entrance you encounter a visual cacophony of interesting furniture together with motifs of Pirot rugs appear in combination with a life-size Terminator sculpture. It sounds crazy, but it actually works! The very concept of the restaurant is based on a combination of Italian and local cuisine, with a special focus on Pirot specialties. Although the menu puts an emphasis on meat, from Pirotski Žešći Lučić to a selections of aged steaks, do not miss the opportunity to try the excellent marinated salmon carpaccio. This is a refreshing prelude and a perfect combination of delicate pieces of marinated salmon and crunchy fresh cucumbers with pine nuts that add another dimension to the texture of the dish. If you are looking for a lighter dinner, try the handmade ravioli filled with pistachio cream and pecorino cheese. The combination of pasta, filling and creamy sauce will gently hug and comfort you. Duck fillet and chicken fillet stuffed with truffle mousse are a treat in themselves. Complete the pleasure with a selection of Serbian and Italian wines, and when you are ready for dessert, the waiters will show you a huge board with pictures of desserts. The chocolate sphere is visually attractive, but the real gem among the sweets is the seemingly simple Tres leches prepared to take you back to your childhood and add another layer of taste. Dinner and a show – that’s what they would call it in Hollywood.

OSM.display_name: Lorenzo & Kakalamba, 110, Цвијићева, МЗ Старина Новак, Palilula, Palilula Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN RUBIN
Review: Surrounded by the greenery of Košutnjak, with a spectacular view of the city, Rubin defines itself as a place of fine local cuisine, a long tradition and an enviable reputation. An elegant interior, discreet and more than pleasant service, a respectable wine list and a great selection of premium drinks make Rubin a unique place, special in every detail. In the summer season, especially on weekends, you need to make a reservation for a table in the garden. On Fridays and weekends they have live jazz music, so we advise you plan enoughtime and not rush anywhere. An absolute recommendation for starters is the steak tartare. In the introductory part, there is also a selection of meat and dairy delicacies, interesting baked kale, deep–fried celery and porcini stew. Glazed cheeks are rightfully one of the specialties of the main menu. They are perfectly tender and served on celery puree. We also recommend the crispy Mangulica bayadere on pea puree, with pickled onions. Zürich–style medallions are another favorite, and in addition to national grilled specialties, there are also tripes, mućkalica, roast veal and cutlet, duck fillet with sweet potato and drumstick in port wine sauce. The tray with sweets is brought out at the end of the meal, it will not be easy to decide between the Raffaello cake, the chocolate sphere or the raspberry gratin, while the Paris– Brest and the interesting, sweet mix in a jar left a great impression like everything we have tasted here.

Title: RESTORAN RUZMARIN
Review: You will find a true oasis of Mediterranean cuisine in the Ruzmarin restaurant, located near the Central Garden residential complex. The menu puts an emphasis is on Greek and Italian cuisine. With a refined, bright interior with lots of glass surfaces, Ruzmarin is an excellent choice for short business lunches, as well as for longer food enjoyment. At the start, don‘t miss the homemade breads, but be careful – it‘s easy to start with them, but it‘s hard to stop. The menu also includes a slightly different chef‘s steak tartare, well done and interesting, grilled cheese from the mountain Rtanj as a combination of local ingredients and a Mediterranean approach to cheese, as well as Italian bruschetta and Greek grapevine leaf rolls. For those who go in the direction of a lighter meal, a meal salad is the usual choice on the menu. There are interesting combinations in the risotto and pasta section, and we recommend the gnocchi with turkey and baby spinach. Here you will eat good Mediterranean squid prepared with an interesting combination of potatoes and spinach, but also slow–cooked lamb shank, so tender that it will melt in your mouth. They also have a good selection of steaks, and Italian specialties, such as saltimbocca. A special offer is a Spanish suckling pig, which according to the Spanish tradition is cut with a plate, but to enjoy this delicacy you need to make an appointment the day before.

Title: BISTRO MALI PIJAC
Review: Mali pijac is situated in a house that is a cultural monument. It boldly combines the styles and techniques of French and Serbian cuisine in the manner of a modern Parisian bistro. Hearty onion soup that you simply cannot skip and real homemade beef soup with dumplings will warm you up. In the introductory part of the recommendations are lucid beef tongue carpaccio with pickled red onion, slaw, and berry vinegar, as well as chicken liver pâté with blackberry jam and onion butter. Pâté is served with magical homemade sourdough bread. Relying on the local and seasonal is one of the hallmarks of the kitchen, so we tried the perfect asparagus risotto, and even better kale in sauerkraut sauce on purple sweet potato puree. The menu also includes delicious potatoes with young kajmak and chive oil, pasta with truffles, and duck on apple and orange puree, while the Mali Pijac pljeskavica, Mangalica fillet and veal sweetbread in demiglace sauce are a nice tribute to the local cuisine. Everything is accompanied by a well–designed wine list with Serbian and French labels, as well as a long list of cocktails. An impressive presentation and a fine harmony of flavors raise the experience to a higher level, and it is rounded off by the indispensable Crêpes Suzette, as well as the baklava with pistachios, which they are proud of, served with milk ice cream. Precise execution, charming approach both in the kitchen, as well as in the ambience and service make this place one of the favorites.

OSM.display_name: The Green Studio, 61, Karadjordjeva, МЗ Зелени венац, Београд (Савски венац), Savski Venac Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: MEZESTORAN DVORIŠTE
Review: Although it is located in the very center of the city, one of the most beautiful gardens in Belgrade is well hidden and tucked away. Mezestoran Dvorište, as its name suggests, relies on an extremely rich menu full of different mezzes that become a rich gastronomic experience when combined with a good selection of domestic wines available by the glass. The menu is made up of an interesting combination of different Mediterranean cuisines, a few local specialties, with a hint of Turkish cuisine specialties. We recommend you try beets with walnuts in a mild yogurt and lime sauce. The extremely simple, but perfectly harmonious, dish will refresh you and prepare you for everything that follows. Lahmacun, a dish with lamb, rich in herb and spice aromas of the Middle East, is another must.Bavette Mare Monte, a dish with fresh mussels, prawns, courgettes and cherry tomatoes, is an impressive gastronomic and visual experience. And the Izmir kebab, juicy and tender meat, perfectly seasoned and served with a refreshing combination of tomatoes, onions, and yogurt on a crusty pita bread. As a slightly gentler option, they have salmon fillet served with bulgur, almonds, and vegetables, with an extremely creamy, almost silky orange, lemon and ginger sauce that gives the fillet a breath of freshness. If there is room left for dessert, we recommend the vanilla slice, big, deliberately chaotic, a bit messy, visually noisy, and fundamentally excellent.

Title: RESTORAN OPERA
Review: Tucked away in one of the busiest pedestrian areas of the city center, the Opera restaurant modestly opens its doors and welcomes everyone who has the desire to experience the delicious notes of its offer. In an elegant classic interior, or in a very pleasant summer garden, the restaurant offers the same atmosphere to its guests all year round. The menu is designed in a way that it takes the best of local cuisine, combining it with selected classics of the world gourmet scene. The diverse selection opens with appetizers such as juicy steak carpaccio served with a fresh dressing of basil, rocket, Parmesan, and crunchy roasted almonds. In a trio of mushrooms, the aromas of porcini mushrooms, button mushrooms and oyster mushrooms alternate one after the other, and the menu also includes several creamy risottos. For the next bite, choose one of the refreshing salad meals, such as the one that combines figs in red wine, iceberg, and goat cheese, or one with homemade pasta. In the main specialties section, gourmet bites await you, such as pork medallions blended gently with prune sauce or Mediterranean turkey in an interesting combination with pumpkin seed dressing. Salmon La bohème offers slightly lighter and equally exotic flavors with a whirlwind of mango, prosciutto, cucumber, and paprika. The note of enjoyment will be completed by some of the desserts, such as the classic or summer version of Opera cake or, perhaps, cooked wheat with ground hazelnuts.

OSM.display_name: 30, Obilićev Venac, Косанчићев венац, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: SHEHER PARK CAFE
Review: Sheher Park Cafe is a great choice if a few of your friends want to go for a drink, and a few would still like to eat something. A true hybrid of cafe and restaurant, this place with a fantastic garden has an extremely rich drink menu with wine labels from various geographical regions, as well as a mixed and rich selection of spirits and cocktails. There is also an enviable selection of nonalcoholic drinks, pressed juices, and premium coffees. The cooks place a serious emphasis on the brunch option. Breakfast is represented by eggs Benedict, omelets, and scrambled eggs. This is followed by a variety of oatmeal and sandwiches, and the Tuna Melt is truly special for all the senses. The series continues with a delicate dinner salad, and we warmly recommend the Thai Shrimp. If you‘re in the mood for a bite to eat while sipping fantastic cocktails, there‘s an exceptional selection of perfectly balanced pizzas. Sheher pizza with parmesan cream and smoked rump steak is praiseworthy. There are also exceptional pastas, such as excellent gnocchi in truffle sauce, which you can enhance with pieces of steak. Madre mio, Premium Salmon and Teriyaki Glazed Tuna are the absolute stars of the kitchen and it‘s really hard to choose a favorite. Be sure to leave room for dessert and try classics like Apple Crumble or Tiramisu, but also a very gentle and refreshing Kiss based on mascarpone cheese with Nutella and seasonal fruit.

Title: MANDARINA CAKE SHOP
Review: Mandarina is a workshop that constantly pushes its boundaries. Family tradition, superior skill and infinite creativity are in croissants with savory and sweet fillings in the morning. The main stars are elegant cakes with rich cream and juicy seasonal or exotic fruits. The decadent Gotham Twist is an irresistibly airy mousse with hazelnuts, the Mille Feuille has seasonal variations, and the VeGe cake perfectly combines hazelnuts, raspberries, and chocolate. Several types of ice cream with unusual and refreshing flavors are offered in summer. Mandarina also has attractively designed gift packages of biscuits, pralines and chocolate bars with mandarin flavors.

Title: RESTORAN ŠARAN
Review: Restaurant Šaran, located on one of the most beautiful parts of the Zemun quay along the Danube, has been an iconic venue for years and is the first association for everyone when you think of fish, Danube and Zemun. As in any serious restaurant, people come to Šaran for several reasons, the main one of which is certainly the top-quality offer of fresh river and sea fish, and seafood. Although restaurants of this type opt for very simple preparation, because the emphasis is on the quality of the food, here on the menu you will find specialties such as Vojvodina style perch fillets - baked in pasta, with smoked cheese and poppy seeds, or interesting combinations such as top-quality tagliatelle with vongole, porcini mushrooms, shrimp, and tomato jam. There is no need to emphasize that the daily offer of fresh sea and river fish is wide. Other, no less important reasons that make Šaran a superior gastronomic destination are certainly the beautiful atmosphere of the old Zemun house, decorated with taste and warmth, and an excellent offer on the wine list, followed by good recommendations from extremely friendly and professional staff. Shrimp, octopus and shrimp tartare, swordfish or tuna carpaccio, smoked carp pâté or swordfish prosciutto, famous fish stew prepared according to a century-old recipe, buzara, risotto and lobster, crispy fish cutlets, medallions and fillets, everything that you can and you can’t imagine is prepared in the Zemun fish temple.

Title: RESTORAN SAKURA
Review: This place is special in that you won’t go wrong whether you’re in the mood for a cocktail, sushi, or a specialty from the Far East. Sakura is modern space with Asian details, and it has a menu made up of a wide variety of cuisines from the Far East. They emphasize visual presentation - expect every dish to be extremely Instagrammable! Yes, sushi is the expected choice, but specialties that will stay in your memory for much longer are also on the menu. For example, Korean Kimchi Tuna, which is most reminiscent of tuna tartare, additionally raised with kimchi and crunchy pieces of vegetables that build on the creamy structure of the tuna and bring a special sour–spicy pleasure in every bite. Sprouts and broccoli will intrigue you, as well as Nasi Goreng, Pad Thai, or tempura specialties. Saint Jacques and grilled vegetables in sweet Sakura sauce and Hoisin Salmon are a real treat for seafood lovers. Stir fry duck with dried chilies and Szechuan pepper brings waves of pleasant spiciness, but also the specific taste of Szechuan, a truly special bite for gourmets. If you like Asian classics, there is Bulgogi or sweet and sour pork. Be sure to leave room for sweets! You will enjoy it if you choose homemade ice cream, we chose excellent sweet potato ice cream, or soft bites of sticky rice.
