Title: RESTORAN AVALICA
Review: The famous Avalica has preserved the bohemian spirit and atmosphere, with thoughtful refreshments both in the ambience and on the menu. It is located across the street from the Red Star Stadion, next to a beautiful garden that is far enough from the street and has a pleasant interior. Avalica is spacious enough for larger gatherings and tucked away enough for more intimate occasions. A display case with a good selection of wine labels perfectly accompanies the menu here, not too long, but quite inspiring and based on tradition in a modern edition. Homemade bread with two types of spreads arrives as a couvert, for starters we recommend a hearty soup, and to warm up meze Avalica or light zucchini rolls filled with creamy goat cheese served on tomato cream, with nuts. In the main part, we tried an interesting Ćevap in Stambolov’s style, where ćevapi are served in a bun with warm sataraš. Juicy beef shin with mlinci au gratin and tender marinated pork ribs are also in the offer. The menu includes a daily offer of traditional dishes – dock patience rolls, potato stew and beans. In the Old Serbia section, there are veal head in tripe, and Leskovac mućkalica. Sweetbread and homemade sausages arrive from the grill, as well as beef cheeks, duck breast, and rib eye steak. Vanilla slice, impressively served in a glass with seasonal fruit, and modern Poljubac Avalica with nutella and mascarpone stand out on the list of desserts. A harmonious blend of experience and youth sets this place apart from others.

Title: RESTORAN BABAROGA
Review: Restaurant Babaroga is one of the few Belgrade restaurants organized as a steakhouse and fully dedicated to working with top quality cuts of meat. Upon entering the restaurant, you are greeted by a powerful bull sculpture that suggestively announces that the experience that awaits you here will be powerful. In a modern and warmly decorated interior as well as in a large garden in the warmer part of the year, you will enjoy a complete portfolio of meat - from pork, lamb to beef that has undergone the dry aging process, to a large section in the menu dedicated only to steak lovers in various forms. From raw tartar and carpaccio to Wellington, and steaks in the most popular sauces. In the premium steak section, you will find Angus beef as well as the highest quality Japanese Wagyu beef, which is respected globally. A large selection of standard cuts of meat - ribeye, steak, T-bone, is also enriched with some that have not become standard in Serbia but have an important place, such as tomahawk or picanha, which is served in smaller portions and is suitable even if you drop in alone, and very much in the mood for a good and tasty piece of meat. The meat is technically expertly processed, so you can rely on your piece of meat to be prepared exactly as you have requested. The excellent wine list is sorted according to the tastes you will enjoy and will nicely accompany your every gastronomic idea of enjoyment.

Title: GIOVANNI’S PIZZERIA
Review: Giovanni‘s pizzeria in the city center is a modern two storey space and it nourishes the Neapolitan pizza. The dough is soft, airy, with a crispy crust that is the result of perfect baking, and special attention is paid to the ingredients, providing a unique combination of flavors and textures. There are ten pizzas on the menu. Naturally, the classics – Margherita and Capricciosa, and for cheese lovers Siciliana with mozzarella, Grana Padano, gorgonzola and Provolone cheeses will be an excellent choice. Invigorating tomato soup served with baked pizza dough is also on the menu. For dessert, the choice is simple, the exceptional creamy tiramisu with pistachio cream – ideal for sharing.

Title: KLUB KOŠUTNJAK
Review: Klub Košutnjak is one of the few places in Belgrade with expertly prepared game meat. Surrounded by greenery, with a beautiful covered garden, away from the traffic and crowd, this restaurant offers an idyllic feeling of being in nature, while the interior is classically decorated. Hunter‘s pate and hearty pheasant soup are our recommendation for starters, and we suggest that you continue on this trail and try spicy hunter‘s sausages, or intriguing dishes with wild boar or deer meat with a characteristic side dish. The menu includes goulash, hearty Karađorđeva steak, good medallions with mushrooms, and the usual national repertoire from the grill, salads are seasonal, and the service is „old school“. The wine list includes labels from Serbia, and desserts include homemade pies (cherry, apple) and hazelnut pie served with a scoop of ice cream and whipped cream.

Title: RESTORAN PLEZIR
Review: Restaurant Plezir, tucked away under the canopy in lower Dorćol, is one of the newer restaurants specialized in fine bistro cuisine. Using techniques and knowledge from the world of fine dining, they manage to raise their dishes to a level where enjoying food becomes an art - from dealing with combinations of flavors, textures, considering presentation and ways to raise the guest‘s experience one level higher. An elegant interior, luxurious, and at the same time relaxed, with lots of wooden details, is inviting and it is associated with hedonism. And Plezir offers hedonism in abundance. The menu changes, but some dishes have already acquired the status of classics and deservedly keep their place on it. Be sure to try two interesting tartars. One is with three types of sea fish with black roe, perfectly seasoned and refreshingly sumptuous, and the second tartar is duck breast with goose liver, an original dish that we have not had the opportunity to try in Serbia until now. High-quality pasta and risotto intrigue with their unusual combinations. Among the main dishes they offer horse steak, slow-cooked lamb, and pork cheeks, and in the fish section all the favorites - grouper, octopus or common sole in various combinations. Lovers of good food have something to enjoy. Their now iconic dessert - marzipan and dark chocolate cigar is as Instagrammable as it is delicious.

Title: RESTORAN ISTOK
Review: Istok brought exotic Vietnamese cuisine to Dorćol in a modern, exciting, and creative way. An interesting interior with discreet oriental details, a sidewalk patio, staff who can explain and recommend menu items all make an original way to get acquainted with the great tastes of Asia. For starters, try the Flavor Bomb, where you roll peanuts, lime, caramelized onions, chili peppers, and a few other exotic ingredients into a leaf of lettuce. The rich Pho is a must, both a soup and a filling meal, with coriander, noodles, vegetables and slices of beef or chicken. In the further tasting, the favorites are sweet and spicy pork with peanuts, ginger, and fried onions, great buns - excellent with cod, as well as duck, and some of the dim sum combinations - prawns, pork, chicken, vegetarian. Sweet potato or kimchi are unusual accompaniments, and when you get to the main course, don’t miss the excellent mi thit bo, beef and rice noodles in oyster sauce, which is highly recommended. Among the main dishes are bibimbap and pad thai, excellently prepared classics of Far Eastern cuisine, red curry with duck, and green curry with vegetables. For a sweet ending, try the attractive pineapple sprinkled with spiced salt, fried banana with peanuts, coconut, and biscuit, and there’s also tapioca pudding and mango caramel. An interesting list of cocktails completes the authentic experience of the East with all the senses.

Title: RESTORAN RUSTIQUE
Review: In the heart of Senjak, where the city pulses at a calm pace, Rustique, brings the Italian soul and flavors of Italy right to your table. This corner, adorned with a warm atmosphere and excellent food, is one of the favorite destinations for anyone looking for an authentic Italian experience. In the extensive menu, you can find a real range of tastes - from authentic Tuscan pastas with a rich porcini mushroom and steak ragout, to juicy steaks, and specialties such as veal saltimbocca or Milanese cutlets with mashed potatoes. But what makes this restaurant special are, of course, the pizzas. Roman style, with a thin crust and plenty of ingredients, each pizza becomes a small ode to the Italian way of life. The selection of pastas and risottos offers interesting combinations, among which we like linguine with gambori, octopus and capers, as well as casarecce with mortadella of protected geographical origin and pistachios. For a sweet ending, don’t miss the pistachio souffle! Rustique is not only a place it well, it is also a corner to exchange anecdotes, laugh loudly, a gathering place of hedonists. Certainly, it’s no wonder that this place is often the first option for lovers of Roman-style pizza and for all those looking for a good bite in this part of the city.

Title: BISTRO TRANDAFILOVIĆ
Review: As a representative of the modern trend, Bistro Trandafilović demonstrates that it is possible to preserve the bohemian kafana spirit in a modern outfit. Both the garden under the big plane tree, and the pleasant interior, as well as the menu, blend tradition and new gastro trends. Spreads of tobacco crackling, eggplant and chicken liver go well with warm buns while you go through the menu, and there’s a good selection of rakija to whet your appetite. As the next step, there are cured meats, Serbian cheeses, zucchini rolls with goat cheese and peppers with feta mousse. The host’s plate is a comprehensive selection of appetizers. Ask your waiter about the offer of roast meat, and the table d’hôte offer. In the gourmet sections, choose from smoked specialties - neck, sausage and drumstick, or grilled ones - carp, catfish, and trout. Čubura and Tranda ćevapi, piquant uštipci and pljeskavica in several versions are a must. Pieces of quality meat with vegetables arrive attractively served in a pan. Their signature dish is a hearty combination with steak, leeks, fresh paprika and Sjenica cheese. Juicy chicken in a smoked cheese sauce served on broad noodles, baked mlinci with pork shank and three types of cheese, Karađorđe steak and imperial skewers, forest fillet and rolled liver in bacon are some of their specialties. Simply – both a bistro and a kafana.

OSM.display_name: Bistro Trandafilovic, 73, Mackenzie, Cubura, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
73, Mackenzie, Cubura, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN DUOMO
Review: Fully dedicated to authentic Italian flavors and dishes, based on tradition with some interesting variations, Duomo is the place for simple and very good Italian cuisine. It is located in Dorćol, with a nice sidewalk garden and an interior on two levels. Cute details, unusual mirrors on the ceiling, checkered tablecloths and friendly staff create an overall warm atmosphere of the osteria where you will feel very comfortable both during the day and in the evening. As an introduction to the local gastronomic world, we recommend a selection of delicacies with olives and capers or the very refreshing and unusually tasty Burrata Di Bufala served with pesto, figs and two types of tomatoes with fresh basil. In the pasta section, gnocchi filled with gorgonzola with truffles and roasted pistachios attract attention. The pizzas arrive from a wood–fired oven, the dough is made from zero–zero flour, and the selection of ingredients is inspiring, ranging from combinations of ventricina – pecorino, and young gorgonzola – prunes, to Caprino with goat cheese and guanciale bacon, to pizzas with salmon, eggplant, steak... In the meat section, don’t miss the powerful Mafioso burger made of black Angus meat with smoked mozzarella and homemade pesto. They also offer sausage on polenta, chicken with San Daniele prosciutto, turkey in limoncello, and steak tagliata topped with Negro Amaro wine sauce.

OSM.display_name: Nachos, 66a, Strahinjica Bana, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
66a, Strahinjica Bana, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN LOVAC
Review: Lovac is famous for its offer, service and as a gathering place for journalists, celebrities, and bohemians. In the heart of Vračar, a wonderful, patio under the canopy and a discreetly revamped interior with hunting details are the environment in which national and wild game specialties come to the fore. Everything will be presented to you by the experienced and friendly staff. Potage made from forest mushrooms is truly unique, with an intense taste, made with Parmesan cheese, walnuts, and raisins, deserves every recommendation. Given the name and reputation, be sure to ask what wild game specialties are on offer. The sausages are nicely spicy, the rabbit with cauliflower and broccoli in a demi-glace sauce is an unusual creation served with barley risotto, and the offer also includes venison steak, wild boar in a cream sauce with truffles, as well as hunter’s basket and venison medallions. Karađorđe steak is a safe choice from the classic repertoire, ćevapi are a simple, but also an excellent choice if you’re in the mood for grilled meat. In this part of the menu, Ćumur is attractively served on your table, as well as gourmet uštipak and pljeskavica in lamb lungs. Tito’s vanilla slice will take you back to the past, and in the sweet section there are also baklava, tulumba, urmašica and chocolate walnut cake. Tradition has been preserved here to a fine extent, and that is something to be especially praised in this region.

OSM.display_name: Restaurant Lovac, 19, Alekse Nenadovica, Крунски венац, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
19, Alekse Nenadovica, Крунски венац, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: FAT BOYS FOOD CO.
Review: This is a place for lovers of beef burgers. The staff is pleasant and ready to recommend and offer everything, from the classic burger, the popular shroom with mushrooms, spicy or smoked burger, double double with everything double, to the veggie burger made of soy, beetroot, carrot and peas. Each burger is accompanied by sauces – chipotle mayo, bacon mayo, mango sauce or fat boy sauce. Sandwiches and tortillas with pulled pork, slow–roasted ribs, or chicken, as well as ribs and wings are equally popular. The choice of potatoes and side dishes is excellent, and we recommend the half– half. The food is accompanied by a good selection of craft beers.

OSM.display_name: Fat Boys Food Co., 3, Strahinjica Bana, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
3, Strahinjica Bana, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: KAFANICA POD LOZOM
Review: Kafanica pod Lozom in Zemun is a real treasure trove of traditional flavors, best presented by friendly waiters. As an introduction, we recommend a rich board with marinated tongue, pâté from cracklings, figs, cheese, delicious buns in oil and spices, and sauerkraut. Among the main dishes, the perfectly juicy sweetbread, grilled intestines, goat‘s cheese or, if you are lucky enough to visit at the right time, kokoreč stands out. A dish with an interesting story is Čorbadžijska mandža, which is over 200 years old. In Kafanica pod Lozom, guests are welcomed as friends, which is another reason why it is always full. With delicious snacks and warm hospitality, body and soul are well nourished here.

OSM.display_name: 31e, Hercegovacka, Колонија Змај, Zemun, Zemun Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: O BISTRO DELICE
Review: Delice is a charming French wine bar that boasts an impressive selection of over 300 wine labels from France and a delicatessen. They also offer wines from Serbia, as well as organic and biodynamic wines. Here you will also find a rich selection of French cheeses, savory and sweet spreads, pâtés, and other delicacies that perfectly accompany the wines. Friendly and professional staff are here to recommend the perfect combinations. A new list of wines by the glass is offered every week. The restaurant is divided into a tasting area, and a section where, in addition to wine, French delicacies are displayed, starting with a scallop spread, tuna rillette, and pancakes, or figs in Armagnac syrup.

OSM.display_name: 47, Gospodar Jovanova, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: SPICE CAFE&RESTAURANT
Review: This cafe restaurant attracts many guests with its authentic Indian cuisine, sumptuous spices, and warm atmosphere. The wide selection of dishes includes all the classics of Indian cuisine, as well as specialties characteristic of certain parts of the country. In the bread category alone, there are ten naan bread options available, from plain to cheese–filled, or peanut–filled. Guests can enjoy a variety of samosas, curry dishes, tandoori specialties, rich vegetarian dishes, as well as biryani rice with chicken, lamb, vegetables, or prawns. To soften the spiciness there is the traditional Indian drink lassi, salty or sweet, and lassi options with mango, lychee or banana are especially popular.

OSM.display_name: Spice, 21a, Zarkovacka, Дипломатско насеље, Михајловац, Београд (Чукарица), Cukarica Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
21a, Zarkovacka, Дипломатско насеље, Михајловац, Београд (Чукарица), Cukarica Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN KLUB KNJIŽEVNIKA
Review: A place that has shaped the social life of Belgrade for decades, the famous Francuska 7; the history of art and politics was created by the guests who sat at their tables, and today it is an intriguing, modern restaurant that nourishes tradition, creatively presenting it in new forms and techniques. The interior was renovated, yet it has preserved its patina, while the marvelous garden is a real jewel in the center of the town. If you choose from the classic menu, first try the gibanica, which takes about 25 minutes to prepare. It arrives on a wooden board, the waiter cuts it in front of you, and it melts in your mouth with an intense cheese flavor. The taste of gibanica goes well with Mangalica sausages and homemade ajvar. Great onion soup with pine nuts and raisins is an unusual variation of a classic, while a crispy lamb pie served with quince jelly is an exciting interpretation of tradition. Lamb roast with southern ragout and mint sauce, Mangalica chops with vodouvan paste and fennel cream, Pešter veal, and impressive duck with a crispy roll, are challenges in the meat section. If you are into fish, we recommend Danube perch or Adriatic Sea bass, turbot with vermouth sauce, or risotto with octopus and crispy squid, with light saffron sauce. Each dish arrives imaginatively served with the clear signature of the chef. Among the desserts, the breakthrough is the modern Maccura cake made of coconut, mango and passion fruit, and the obligatory, famous Buda’s Vanilla slice, which brings back old memories.

OSM.display_name: 7, Francuska, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN MAGELLAN
Review: Refined and prestigious, Magellan is the right choice for an exciting and unique gastro cruise. It conquers with elegance both in the interior and in the beautiful garden. Once you are comfortably seated, all you need to do is let the friendly staff recommend, present, and serve their guests with care. The sumptuous wine list with over 200 labels, and an impressive selection of alcoholic beverages and cocktails also contribute to the overall experience. The complete atmosphere is provided by the Set menu in five or eight gangs. For starters, an excellent and attractive steak tartare is indispensable, as well as foie gras and octopus with roasted peppers, burrata with pesto, and smoked sea bass carpaccio. A novelty in the fish section, swordfish, is precisely prepared and harmoniously combined with roasted cauliflower and sun-dried tomato sauce. You can also enjoy seafood soup or beef consommé, as well as a selection of pastas and risottos. Juicy and tender sous vide veal on expertly prepared Robuchon puree with butter conquers with a powerful harmony of flavors. Sea bass with basil foam, turbot in frankincense sauce or perch with kohlrabi cream in the fish section of the offer, and duck fillet, warm goose liver, lamb back or some of the steaks in the meat section, present new gastronomic horizons. Desserts from the Paradise Island section are named after their key ingredient – coffee, coconut, mango, nougat, sour cherry or strawberry. The desserts play with forms, textures, colors, and tastes.

Title: RESTORAN GIG
Review: Restaurant GIG is a new project of an already experienced group of restaurateurs, which is the only one of their projects dedicated to haute cuisine. The restaurant is based on the principles and values applied to successfully manage for years the Imperator winery, which is owned by them. These are the principles of biodynamic production, which in the case of GIG is reflected in a full commitment to the quality of ingredients, dealing with their origin and growing vegetables in their biodynamic garden. Also, the same principles apply in the responsible approach to sustainability, the use of free- range animals, game and fish that live in their natural habitats. The exceptional wine list, in addition to wines from the Imperator winery, also includes some of the most interesting wines of the world scene, a selection of magnum bottles, natural wines, and exclusive labels that you can only find in their restaurant. In addition to the main tasting menu of 8+ courses, there are no less interesting vegetarian, fish, and caviar menus for two. We also recommend a great wine pairing with a tasting menu that will elevate your experience to the highest level. A beautiful interior decorated with natural materials as well as authentic, interesting details, such as water placed on crystals, to absorb good energy, as well as extremely friendly and dedicated service will take you out of your busy everyday life and lead you on a path of relaxation and enjoyment.

Title: ETNO RESTORAN ZLATAR
Review: The Zlatar restaurant has been a place for good national cuisine for many years, mostly oriented towards specialties from the Zlatar mountain region. A warm tavern atmosphere and experienced waiters jointly guide you through a beautiful evening, which is often complemented by the sounds of live music. The extensive wine list is commendable because there is no kafana without wine, and there is no kafana without rakija, and here they offer 31 versions of their own production. The entire stretch from Užice to the Zlatibor and Zlatar mountains produces good food for appetizers, so don’t miss tasting various prosciutto, fillet, Zlatar cheese with a protected geographical origin and different types of kajmak. In the winter period, there are also pork aspic with good homemade sauerkraut, and steak tartare. Buckwheat pie, as one of the iconic Zlatar specialties, is certainly not to be missed. You can warm your stomach with veal or lamb cream soup and beef noodle soup. Veal under sač is certainly one of the favorites of the local guests, and there is also braised goat in milk, shoulder in sauerkraut or lamb under sač. Tasty potatoes from the same sač accompany the tender and tasty meat, while a ball of kajmak is there to add heartiness for gourmets, although the selected pieces are just right - not too lean. A wide selection of grilled specialties completes the offer as well as cooked daily meals, so be sure to ask the waiter for a recommendation.

OSM.display_name: Ресторан “Златар”, 9a, Preradoviceva, МЗ Хаџипоповац, Palilula, Palilula Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN MALI RAJ
Review: Close to both Belgrade and Pančevo, Mali Raj is a pleasant oasis worth escaping to from the hustle of the city. The beautiful large garden and the interior offer a truly special experience. The extensive menu includes the national standard offer, international classics, seafood and fish, and their famous specialties. We recommend starting the meal with excellent grilled cheese, and they also offer meze and a Mali Raj big plate, as well as salmon carpaccio and shrimp cocktail in cognac and dill sauce. To warm up, veal and fish soup, homemade broth with noodles or minestrone, and then the complete national repertoire from the grill. Followed by turkey with mlinci in gorgonzola sauce, steak in sauce with three kinds of mushrooms, Wiener and Pariser schnitzel, beef stroganoff, Leskovac mućkalica, and chicken with honey and wild berries. In the fish section, there are squid, stuffed and fried, deep–fried crabs, salmon, and Grand Marnier prawns. Favorites are singled out at the very beginning of the menu, so don‘t miss out on trying the Opanak, minced meat stuffed with prosciutto, bell pepper, and cheese, topped with chicken and kajmak, or the Monastery chicken deep fried in walnuts. You should also consider the daily recommendations, including head in tripes, grilled liver, venison stew, lamb shins, cooked veal, and beef shin on kajmak. Finally, a classic selection of classic desserts, tufahija and baklava, pancakes and walnut meringue, chocolate tart or fig cake in summer.

OSM.display_name: 163, Панчевачки пут, Reva, Palilula, Palilula Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11060, Serbia

Title: MAJSTOR I MARGARITA
Review: The name itself of the place, there are two trump cards of a successful pizzeria – a good pizza master and a good Margherita pizza. Their pizza has been one of 50 best pizzas in Europe for several years in a row. The most popular variations are the Margherita, followed by the unusual Mortadella e pistachio, with a pistachio pesto, Provolone, mortadella, basil and crushed pistachios that are a wonderful contrast to the soft dough. Chia is a pizza with the famous Pirot cheese made according to a traditional recipe, and for the perfect spiciness there is Pizza Diavola with Ventricina sausage. They also serve potages, sandwiches and salads, and the drink menu features local producers of beer, rakija, gin, and wine.

OSM.display_name: Freska, 12, Vuka Karadžića, Косанчићев венац, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: TAVERNA PIATAKIA
Review: There is a real Greek tavern in Zemun, like an island of Greece decorated in traditional Greek style, with white walls and blue details. You can find all the classic Greek specialties on the menu. It starts with cold and hot appetizers – stuffed grape leaves, refreshing salad rich in olives, grilled halloumi or feta cheese, zucchini fritters with tzatziki salad. There are also hearty dishes with meat or seafood – roast juicy lamb, souvlaki, crispy squid with spicy mayonnaise. If you are a fan of cooked dishes, don‘t miss the traditional Greek moussaka. Greek wines and the famous Metaxa go perfectly with the dishes.

OSM.display_name: Taverna Piatakia, 10, Novogradska, Cukovac, Zemun, Zemun Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
10a, Novogradska, Cukovac, Zemun, Zemun Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: ĆEVAP KOD DEKIJA
Review: In a real oasis for lovers of traditional charcoal barbecue, with rakija that will whet the appetite, the meal starts with an appetizer, and there are the must–have grilled Miroč cheese škripavac, fluffy cracklings, urnebes dip, kajmak and homemade ajvar. The star of the menu is Sarajevo ćevap in flatbread with finely chopped onions, famous for their irresistible taste and texture. The menu also includes gourmet pljeskavica, spicy homemade sausages, veal strips served on a hot dish, the famous tripes and veal liver. Brewed coffee with baklava or dumplings with plums rounds off the nice experience. Without a doubt, this is a place where every meal turns into an unforgettable experience.

OSM.display_name: Ћевап код Декија, 71, Strahinjica Bana, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
71, Strahinjica Bana, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN JERRY
Review: Classy, exclusive, and luxurious, Jerry offers a complex and complete fine dining experience in every respect. Well-coordinated staff, selection of top-quality food and ingredients, and an impressive list of spirits and a rich wine list make a visit to this restaurant a unique hedonistic experience. The guests are won over on their first step, when hot chopsticks and a selection of breads arrive at your table, together with goat cheese from their farm in Homolje, olive tapenade and chive spread. The persuasiveness of local flavors is confirmed by the powerful hand-cut steak tartare with pine nuts, served with aromatic butter, perfectly matched by the effective deep-fried goat cheese balls with almonds and served in a spicy sweet-hot sauce. The menu also offers Wagyu and Black Angus steaks, as well as lobster and fresh fish from the Adriatic. Creamy Arborio rice risotto with saffron and shrimp represents part of the menu, which also includes excellent foams with tomato, steak, and pomegranate. In the meat section, we draw your attention to lamb back and baked rib eye with flambéed gnocchi, an interesting combination of tomahawk steak and marinated chanterelles, and veal cheeks with chive puree. Tuna from the Josper oven and salmon with teriyaki sauce are in the fish section. The impressive wine list adequately represents Serbia and exclusive world labels. In the sweet section, two favorites stand out - an attractive gianduja dessert, and a brilliant mille feuille with forest fruits.

OSM.display_name: Трешњиног цвета, Danube Quay, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11070, Serbia
Трешњиног цвета, МЗ Икарус, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11070, Serbia

Title: KALEMEGDANSKA TERASA
Review: This unique restaurant is located in Belgrade’s largest park and beautiful fortress. Kalemegdanska Terasa offers a gourmet pleasure, and it will wake all your senses in a pleasant way. The terrace has a glazed part, and the view stretches out unobstructed before you, while you enjoy the food and the wines from the carefully selected wine list. Because of all this and because of the tradition, which is an obvious motif in the menu and in the decoration, this is one of the most beautiful restaurants in Belgrade. You won’t go wrong if you opt for dishes of traditional French gastronomy, such as the excellent creamy goose liver terrine, served with crusty bread with cranberries and silky fig jam and steak tartare, or for local traditional bites, such as warm crispy pie with tender cheese, served with ajvar and Serbian meze. The stewed veal served with creamy mashed potatoes with truffles is so tender that one can eat it with a spoon. We recommend the irresistibly tender beef cheeks. If you are in the mood for something more substantial, and you plan to dine with a larger group, roasted lamb shoulder with ratatouille in Tamjanika sauce is a great choice. For a lighter dinner, we recommend baked octopus and seabass or grilled perch fillet, with perfectly crispy skin, and for dessert – floating island!

Title: RESTORAN SALON 5 A
Review: If you haven’t heard of this restaurant, it shouldn’t surprise you because its unobtrusiveness and discreet charm are obviously a deliberate part of the image of exclusivity it cultivates. Located in a salon–type apartment in a quiet street, near the center of Zemun, its existence is hinted at only by a small inscription on the building’s intercom. Once you step inside and help yourself to cold water and a strip of quince confit, you will have the feeling that you have come to the home of an old friend, with an interior decorated in an eclectic style, combining modern and retro. Friendly staff headed by a chef will make your fine dining experience memorable. The menu changes every few months and is reduced to a maximum, the dishes carry interesting names, yet the choice is such that everyone can find something. In the current, colorful menu, where the dish symbolizes an explosion of colors, flavors and harmonized aromas, the appetizer paradise opens the colorful harmony. It’s a mix of sundried cherry tomatoes and melon balls, with dried, crispy buđola (Capocollo), served in a cream cheese sauce, with the addition of olive oil and essence of ramsons. The following gourmet pleasure is summed up in three words – coin coin coin. It is marinated duck breast, with a side of grilled asparagus, demi–glace sauce with pine nuts, Dijon mustard and, to top it all, a piece of goose pate. Finally, try the italodisco – a chocolate sponge cake dipped in vanilla sauce, with the addition of raspberry and kiwi extract, and a cooked peach served over the sponge cake.

OSM.display_name: 5, Avijaticarski trg, Donji Grad, Zemun, Zemun Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN RADNIČKI
Review: Although the location is a bit out of the way, this is a must–see destination for all foodies. Everything that Radnički offers leaves an excellent impression and is worth going to. The spacious restaurant also has a garden, which is full, from spring to autumn. The local cuisine is responsible for the modern and effective execution of national dishes, which represent tradition in a creative and interesting way, adding new notes and forms. Pie, stunning in aroma and taste, melted cheese with prosciutto and crispy rolls served with barley and smoked cheese sauce, are warm recommendations for starters. There are all kinds of meat delicacies, kajmak and urnebes, cheeses and fresh seasonal salads, tartar, and homemade spreads. A selection of breads and scones are favorites in every part of the menu. When it comes to grilled meat, there’s ćevapčići and uštipci, pork tenderloin rolls and the unusual Grandma’s pljeskavica on spinach puree. For larger groups, attractively served Ćup and Daska Radnički in dough, Karađorđeva steak is plentiful and juicy, and among the specialties, soft Shepherd’s ribs on kajmak, veal breast on pita bread, Mangalica and pork shank bun, turkey gorgonzola rolls in sesame and good choice of steak stand out. They have an excellent selection of rakija, and a wine list based on Serbian wineries and the region. The sweet finish includes excellent baklava with pistachios and ice cream, a modern meringue with raspberries and pistachios, vanilla slice, pancakes and Vasa’s cake.

OSM.display_name: Radnicki, 190, Тошин бунар, Bezanijska Kosa, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11070, Serbia
190, Тошин бунар, Bezanijska Kosa, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11070, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN PANTA REI
Review: Within the sports center „25. maj“ in lower Dorćol, there is Panta Rei, a restaurant that has been a feature of this area for three decades.With a warm welcome, the charming staff will accommodate you in a comfortable corner with a view of the Danube. Perhaps it is most pleasant to come here during a late breakfast and try the excellent panta rei sandwich with prosciutto on brioche bread. If you want to eat lunch, dive into the starters first. The steak parmesan bagel is truly a wonderful experience! Our advice is to order the steak medium rare so that you can really feel all the flavors that this dish has to offer. Then indulge yourself in the wine list and the flavors of the Mediterranean. You certainly won‘t make a mistake, whether you choose the Pazin gnocchi in a fine cream of truffle, turkey and pecorino, or you choose the risotto with saffron, prawns, asparagus and pecorino. If your gourmet mood goes in the direction of something more substantial, go for the pork shank with mlinci and mushrooms. In that combination, you‘re really not sure what will melt in your mouth first. We recommend the slow–roasted boned pork ribs, so soft that you can eat them with a spoon, as well as the spectacular veal under sach in milk. There is also a truly exceptional selection of Mediterranean fish that can be grilled for you.

OSM.display_name: Univerzitet Metropolitan, 63, Tadeusa Koscuska, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11158, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN SINĐELIĆ
Review: Considering the long tradition, everyone knows the Sinđelić restaurant. Next to the football field of the Sinđelić soccer club, this is one of those traditional restaurants where you’ll find everything you’re looking for. There are experienced, quick, and skillful waiters, a wide selection of national specialties that comes out of the kitchen, and a harmonious atmosphere that successful restaurants of this capacity exude. Although spacious, Sinđelić is usually full like a beehive, especially on weekends, yet everything flows smoothly. For starters, we suggest the Sinđelić snack, or deep–fried breaded peppers stuffed with cheese, together with quality rakija, and the choice is good – salad like Sjenica bell peppers in sour cream, or grilled chili peppers in oil and garlic, followed by veal soup or beef soup with noodles to warm up your stomach and then you can choose something from the large selection of main dishes. If you prefer lighter food, there is a hearty salad, risotto and pasta. For those with a stronger appetite, or perhaps hungrier, we recommend grilled meat, aged steaks, chicken, turkey and veal specialties, as well as the national pride – sač. The specialties of the house are Sinđelić saber with three types of meat, Čačak ćevapčići and uštipci. Don’t miss the dessert, because you will surely like some of the cakes they will present in front of you.

Title: MIAMIAM RESTAURANT&CATERING
Review: Located just two minutes from the Kalenić Market, Miamiam offers authentic Indian food representing different regions, with dedicated staff on hand to help you choose. The main feature of the menu is interesting and authentic dishes that combine the best of European and Indian cuisine. For breakfast, there is omelet, avocado toast, and our suggestion is to try the fried vegetable dough with blueberry hummus. For the main course, there are different types of curries, from vegetarian to meat options, daal, biryani, paired with roti, basmati rice or seasonal chutneys with crusty bread. Spicy bites go well with home–made Indian lemonade with soda water and raspberry puree, with a touch of salt.

OSM.display_name: 39, Курсулина, Cubura, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
39a, Курсулина, Cubura, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: CVEĆE ZLA
Review: It seems that the new location of Cveće zla has become accepted in the minds of their guests as if the move never happened. One of the main reasons for such easy adaptation of their guests is above all the exceptional quality. It is not without reason that it is said that it is easy to get used to good, and even easier to get used to great! There is the well–known vibe of the legacy of the atmosphere of the old Dijagonala, as well as the top service that has always been the trademark of the hospitality ventures of the experienced owner. Classics in their best ever versions are on the plates. If it’s your first time in this restaurant, don’t miss the steak tartare, or the classic tuna tartare. Goose liver is a must for gourmets, and celery with anchovies for vegetarians. Then go for the redesigned burek with mortadella and pistachios or baked bone marrow, and after a few glasses of wine and a chat, you’ll be ready to continue your journey through the local attractive menu. Every pasta on offer is at the level of excellent Italian past, and we especially recommend the ricotta gnocchi. For fish lovers there is grilled salmon and tuna, and the meat lovers will not go wrong with a choice of veal, burger, steak, ćevap, or sausage. With a beautifully designed wine list and a fine selection of wines by the glass, you can easily stroll through the hedonistic experience of Cveće zla.

Title: PETAR AT TIKA’S
Review: When you turn towards the Petar At Tika’s restaurant from the very busy Dragoslav Srejovića street, you will first see the beautiful canopy shading the large patio of this very charming restaurant. The friendly, professional, and pleasant staff will escort you to your table where excellent olive oil and various goodies are already served, and you can enjoy them with excellent homemade bread. When choosing from the minimalistic but very deliberate menu, be sure to check with the staff, because they often have some new and exciting dishes that are not listed on the menu. Of the permanent stars of the menu, be sure to start with beef tea, or panko–breaded celery. The extremely thinly sliced celery becomes creamy, and the perfectly crispy panko breading that envelops it provides an exciting contrast in texture. You can‘t go wrong with pork ribs bayadere, Old Scholl veal cutlet, or veal shank in suprême sauce. Each fiber be separated with a spoon, while the sauce has an almost silky texture, and even the classic mashed potatoes as a side dish are prepared in an excellent way. A seriously prepared classic indeed! Consider also Sicilian–style prawns, sea bass tartare with tzatziki cream, and charcoal–grilled octopus leg. Whether it‘s seafood, or selected cuts of meat, this restaurant prepares them without fail. After all, until the next experience, treat yourself with Opium ball or a French Kiss.

OSM.display_name: Yettel, 1b, Dragoslava Srejovica, МЗ Стара Карабурма, Palilula, Palilula Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11060, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN STARI ŽABAR
Review: The team of experienced restaurateurs who enthusiastically took over the management of the Stari žabar restaurant a few years ago has justified my trust. Everything that the guest enjoys - from the ambiance, services, wine list and menu - has been raised to a higher level, while at the same time Žabar has not lost any of the charm that I love so much. Certainly one of the most beautiful locations for lunch with a view of the river and a traditional destination for enjoyment can boast of an exceptional quality of service. Professional and elegant, yet warm and relaxed at the same time. A large part of the specialties on the menu are now well-known classics whose quality is talked about. There is, first of all, the famous turkey with mlinci, smoked steak and tuna, as well as the traditional Žabar apetizer with warm buns to start, as well as our favorite - octopus with pistachios covered in butter. As for meat, we recommend veal filet and duck leg, excellent duck breast, and lamb and veal cutlets. The position on the water means that Žabar serves excellent river and sea fish. It goes without saying that the friendly waiters will give you a quality recommendation. To round off the enjoyment, there is an extremely wide and well-selected wine list from which you can easily pair wine with food. For the very end, don’t miss Grandma Dara’s refreshing fruit cake.

Title: STEAK & WINE BAR
Review: There aren‘t many restaurants where they can literally physically walk you through their wine list. This is what you get in the pleasant atmosphere of the Steak & Wine bar. The well–informed staff will take you on a tour of the impressive selection of wines, and then recommend and agree with you on the best strategy and choice to accompany your meal. From the name of the restaurant, it‘s obvious that steaks are a specialty here, so you can‘t go wrong with the choice of steak. The meat is top quality, the excellent team of chefs knows how to cook it to perfection, and we suggest you ask for medium rare. Before you indulge in the wonderful flavors of steaks, be sure to try the tartare. Steak tartare La France is an exceptional classic with a creamy texture and perfectly balanced spices. Apart from beef, there are two other types of tartare – horse meat tartare and fish tartare with avocado. It‘s great that they have tartare in half portions, and you can combine two flavors on one plate. As a lighter alternative, there are excellent handmade pastas with truffles, veal, or prawns, as well as an excellent steak salad. We recommend you try the aged ćevapi on kajmak that melt in your mouth, and each bite is a perfect combination of an extremely soft structure and the finest taste of beef meat.

OSM.display_name: 73, Liberation Boulevard, Činovnička Kolonija, МЗ Чиновничка колонија, Београд (Вождовац), Vozdovac Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11115, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN KOVAČ
Review: The former kafana was carefully preserved and revamped into a pleasant national restaurant. It has been in the same location for almost a century, carefully nurturing and respecting the Serbian culinary tradition. The large indoor space has an interestingly designed section with a wine offer, one hall is non-smoking, while the spacious garden is nicely hidden from the busy street. The service is fast and efficient, the offer is based on meat favorites presented in the spirit and style of the new age, and live music adds to the atmosphere. To begin with, there is a hearty cold snack, and for warming up, a non-standard hot and sour tomato soup with smoked cheese, and a hearty white cream soup with veal and chicken breast. Of the hot appetizers, we draw your attention to chicken liver with caramelized red onion, rolls with aromatic crème fraiche, and pasta with steak and porcini mushrooms. In the Traditional Serbian section, you will find grilled meat, mućkalica and Karađorđe steak, gratinated hunter’s schnitzels and juicy smoked pork shank in horseradish sauce with pasta. Next comes the specialty section, with chicken and turkey in several versions on one side, and steak and tomahawk steak on the other. Somewhere in between are excellent ribs in sač, and lamb and veal chops. The sweet end is rounded off by an interesting cream cake with ice cream and sour cherry topping, tiramisu with pineapple and quince, vanilla slice with berries, orasnica, cold pancakes, or warm chocolate souffle.

OSM.display_name: Kovač, 221, Liberation Boulevard, МЗ Горњи Вождовац, Београд (Вождовац), Vozdovac Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11040, Serbia

Title: BISTRO GRAD HOMETOWN FOOD
Review: If you are looking for a relaxed atmosphere with a cocktail or food, you are in the right place. Bistro grad combines food, drink, design and entertainment into an original story. The menu is inspired by Balkan traditions, Mediterranean spirit, and exotic notes of Asia. It is popular at breakfast and brunch time. To start the day, they offer healthy granola, as well as Kombat buns with eggs, kajmak and roast drippings, all the way to grandma‘s scrambled eggs and cicvara. Small dishes are perfect for brunch - veggie or horse tartare, or baked eggplant with goat cheese. The main dishes include classics such as pljeskavica, pasta, sausage with potato, and there are also exceptional flavors such as Japanese cauliflower.

OSM.display_name: 5, Uzun Mirkova, Косанчићев венац, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: KAFE POSLASTIČARNICA MOSKVA
Review: The iconic patisserie has always been synonymous with elegance and tradition. This has been the place to always come back to, from the beginning of the 20th century. It has a great view of the Terazije square. Entering the patisserie is a leap through time, because the interior has preserved the authenticity of the art nouveau style, with refined details, marble, imposing chandeliers and a concert piano. The offer includes traditional delicacies – pancakes, small cakes, baklava, cooked wheat or chestnut purée with whipped cream... In addition to the famous Moscow schnitte, which has been a symbol of this place for decades, as proof that pastry chefs keep up with the times, there are also modern desserts inspired by the latest world trends, as well as vegan and raw treats.

Title: KONOBA & WINE BAR TATA MATA
Review: Located in an old, elegant villa near the Vukov Spomenik, this restaurant will immediately evoke memories of summer, the smells and tastes of the sea, and the sound of waves. The friendly staff will welcome you warmly with a sincere smile, the Dalmatian way. If you want intimacy and a unique experience of being served in a private room of the villa or, on the other hand, premium wine pairings, an excellent selection of labels that the tavern offers, along with a specially created menu, the hosts will gladly indulge you. The carefully designed menu hides pleasure in every bite. Try the juicy, grilled prawns in a sauce of soy, onions and peppers that go well with mashed potatoes with cuttlefish ink, or the seductive cod in bianco, served on homemade crostini. For risotto lovers, the true delicacy is creamy risotto with fresh or smoked seafood and steamed vegetables. Leave room for the main catch - grilled octopus tentacles, soft inside and crispy outside, with garlic dressing and a vegetable side dish, a combination you don’t want to miss. If you want to experience a Dalmatian delicacy that is not a gift from the sea, they have excellent prosciutto, Pag cheese, or pašticada with meat and gnocchi that melt in your mouth in perfect harmony. The desserts in Tata Mata workshop, served at request, will round off your visit.

Title: RESTORAN DORIAN GRAY
Review: A pleasant interior and a shady garden under the canopy, along with an elegant setting, good service, and a wine list with a respectable number of labels, are just some of the reasons to choose this restaurant in Dorćol. The menu is broad enough to make an interesting walk around the world. We chose to start our meal with excellent, traditional Parmigiana di Melanzane, and an intriguing baked mushroom julienne cream, served with toasted bread. Among the starters are tartares - steak and tuna, carpaccio and Mangalica delicacies, and bruschetta, sauteed wild mushrooms and squid a la Andalucía. If you prefer pasta or risotto, we recommend tagliatelle with prosciutto and truffles, or risotto with Arborio rice and seafood. The selection of specialties includes steaks in various options, and our attention was drawn to the excellent Skvodorovka, an attractively served Russian dish, impressively spicy combination with pieces of beef fillet, aromatic potatoes, onions, and mushrooms. Tuna with sesame and pepper and teriyaki salmon, sea bass and sea bream, Mediteraneo prawns, and grilled squid are the main offerings in the fish section, and duck with honey and apricots, veal cheeks in polenta and Zerak chicken in the meat section. Finally – Oscar Wilde & Dorian Gray. The first is an imaginatively served Belgian chocolate cake with blueberries and chopped hazelnuts, and the second are creamy pancakes filled with mascarpone cheese, whipped cream, and dried fruit, and topped with orange syrup.

OSM.display_name: Dorian Grey, 87-89, Kralja Petra, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN CANTINA DE FRIDA
Review: The extremely colorful and vibrant ambiance of this iconic restaurant will instantly convey the spirit of South America to you. The shabby chic design of the restaurant fits perfectly with the pleasant promenade in front of the Beton hall and the view of the river. Whether you are in the mood for a quiet lunch paired with some fine wine or for an exciting dinner with music and a quality cocktail, Cantina de Frida can handle both situations with equal quality. In addition to the selection of cheeses and prosciutto, we recommend tapas. We single out those with excellent crispy squid, which will be phenomenally accompanied by cold draft beer, and excellent kalamata olives in a salsa of dried peppers and cumin. If you need something to warm you up, then Peruvian soup with prawns and glass noodles is the right choice. Of course, we cannot venture into the gastronomy of South America without recognizing Asad, a traditional technique of grill preparation that recognizes food as a social event and the most important factor of enjoyment. Carefully selected pieces of meat, from T–bone steak, rib-eye steak, and even octopus to slightly smoked chorizo sausages with a Spanish mixture of spices, with a special grilling method become mouth–watering bites. From a rich selection of wine labels from all over the world, you can choose a wine according to your affinity. But if you are in the mood for something quick and tasty, there is a wide range of Tex–Mex cuisine such as tacos, burritos, fajitas and of course, burgers.

Title: RESTORAN DURMITOR
Review: Durmitor is the place to go for spit-roasted meat. Delicious, and juicy veal, lamb, and goat meat has been prepared here from its opening until today. Make a reservation, both for a table, and the roast. Conveniently hidden in the central part of New Belgrade, with the interior part on the upper floor, this restaurant has been extended to a large and very pleasant garden. In the morning you will have a choice of substantial breakfast options, and in lunch time, do not skip the excellent veal soup. In any case, our recommendation in the introductory part goes to the local steak tartare, serious, convincing, and nicely spicy, and next to it, there are selections of meat delicacies and cheeses, as well as deep-fried oyster mushrooms and bell peppers with cheese. Apart from the famous, already mentioned roast, the main menu offers meat in all forms. Tuna steak, salmon, trout, and squid represent the fish segment of the offer. Everything is accompanied by a serious wine list, which is dominated by Serbian and regional wines. The local steak in olive oil is famous, the attractively served Karađorđe steak is a frequent choice, and we also recommend the marinated neck and lamb pljeskavica. They prepare everything in order on the grill, while the selection of steaks is separate in the beef section. In the sweet section, depending on the season, they offer au gratin raspberries or tangerines, and tres leches, poppy seed cake and homemade vanilla slice are also recommended.

Title: DOKOLICA BISTRO VRAČAR
Review: Bistro Dokolica is a favorite meeting place throughout the week, regardless of whether you want to enjoy a quick lunch, a relaxed brunch or dinner. For years, this place has been attracting guests with its pleasant atmosphere and menu. Hand–made gnocchi with different flavor combinations stand out. You will enjoy light gnocchi on butter, sage, and parmesan, gnocchi in red ragu or in gorgonzola sauce. When it gets cold, come here for the famous goulash in beer with crispy puff pastry. If you crave smaller bites, there are delicious tapas and light salads. The offer of the day includes potages that change regularly to reflect the freshness of seasonal ingredients.

Title: JAM - JUST A MAESTRO
Review: Exciting and playful, inspiring, and creative, Just A Maestro is one of those places that will charm you at first glance and first bite. It is a synthesis of all the elements of modern hospitality: effectively designed interior, table setting and service, and well-coordinated and trained staff. And, naturally, a signature menu and a carefully designed wine list. The tartar is expertly prepared, perfectly tasty, and served with homemade brioche, capers, cucumbers and pickled onions, and an aioli sauce to manage the spiciness. Duck liver pâté or duck rillettes are also tempting appetizers, and don’t skip the sumptuous bouillabaisse with mussels, sea bass and prawns. In the pasta and risotto section, land and sea are skilfully combined. Tortellini with ricotta and pesto, sprinkled with almonds, and linguini with large prawns in pistachio sauce. Black risotto from Adriatic cuttlefish and ribeye stand out as distinctive specialties of the house, the JAM burger is attractively served under a cloche, and homemade sausages and Mangalica cutlet are a fine tribute to the local cuisine. Ask which Adriatic fish is on offer, and don’t miss the perfectly tender duck with celery puree and barley risotto. An intriguing list of cocktails and a wine list that boldly cruises through Serbia and various meridians harmoniously pairing tastes. The rhapsody continues with chocolate tart sprinkled with sea salt and blueberry cake with lemon balm and lemon. Imaginative and magical, no less.

OSM.display_name: Knez Miletina, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: IVA NEW BALKAN CUISINE
Review: Vanja Puškar, the main and responsible person standing behind the entire New Balkan Cuisine scene, says that Iva is a bistro that got out of control - in the most positive sense! The unpretentious interior is complemented by the pleasant and friendly staff. The waiters are warm and caring professionals, you will feel you are having lunch with dear friends. The cuisine is based on local Balkan specialties, all of which are skillfully twisted or turned upside down in such a way that they become completely new specialties. While you browse the menu, whet your appetite with one of the specialty cocktails. Crispy buckwheat rolls filled with cheese and drizzled with honey and sprinkled with walnuts are an unreal game of paradoxes- simultaneously hot and cold, crunchy and creamy, sweet and bitter-salty. Don’t miss the beef buns or the magical crispy fried beef legs. Continue intriguing your palate with the perfect pork bayadere, or homemade gnocchi with calf’s brain in an exquisite oxtail sauce. Spectacular vegetarian dishes in the Balkans? O yes! You will remember celery root confit in celery and truffle cream for a long time! A delicate and creamy dish, where the bold aroma of celery blends very finely with the aroma of butter and truffles. Round off the experience with cauliflower cake or homemade gnocchi prepared with plum stone flour. These gnocchi are playing with the deconstruction of grandma’s favorite delicacy - plum dumplings.

OSM.display_name: 11, Kneginje Ljubice, Dorcol, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN AMBAR
Review: Located in the heart of Belgrade’s Beton Hall, Ambar is one of the restaurants that have a modern approach to Balkan cuisine. In their case, modernity implies a certain freedom in the interpretation of dishes and evokes a sense of cuisine fusion. This is certainly the most logical approach to the Balkans as a gastronomic destination. Most of the menu is served in a smaller portion format, which we enjoy because it gives us the opportunity to try more different specialties. The offer includes interesting cauliflower popcorn with a secret dressing, a baked flatbread filled with hummus and cheese, bell peppers with crumbled cheese and kalamata olive jam. Don’t skip gibanica served on yoghurt with a gentle touch of mint. It is perfect! Followed by a few classics from the specialty section, such as their popular monastery chicken deep fried in almonds and walnuts, Mediterranean-inspired lamb meatballs, but also classic ćevapi served with finely chopped onions and spicy paprika. Spicy pljeskavica enriched with roasted peppers and then coated with demi-glace, classic Karađorđe schnitzel or Ambar ćevapi sprinkled with mature cow’s cheese served on vegetables are among the main dishes and will be a challenge even for gourmet guests. For the end, we recommend the Vanilla slice or floating island. You will enjoy it.

Title: MALA KOLUBARA NA RECI
Review: Mala Kolubara, a name we know well from its original downtown location, has moved to the river, the Sava embankment, a location that is becoming increasingly popular in terms of gastronomy. A rustic ambience, with pictures of old Belgrade, and a spacious terrace on the river adds a relaxing note to the homely atmosphere. A glass of rakija will whet your appetite just like reading the menu, where the national cuisine is based on meat specialties. As a warm appetizer, we recommend crispy rolls in an intense combination of goat cheese, prosciutto and peppers. Do not skip burek pljeskavica served on burek dough, one of the specialties here. A juicy pljeskavica with kajmak arrives on an interesting base decorated with urda urnebes. If you’re looking for something lighter, we suggest Zlatibor chicken baked with chopped peppers and prosciutto in a kajmak sauce. Make sure you ask what’s on the menu from roasts and daily cooked dishes. Pork neck and ribs, shredded pork loin, ćevapi and excellent sausages, Šumadija opanak and rumpsteak in olive oil with cheese kept in animal hide (mešina) continue the local gourmet series, which is complemented by the šopska or moravska salad in the summer, and sauerkraut, pickles, and homemade ajvar in the winter. Sweeten yourself with baklava or fruit crepes, and we recommend that you save room for a large slice of excellent Vasa’s cake, which is juicy, refreshing, and creamy, just the way it should be.

OSM.display_name: Мала Колубара, 7a, Савски насип, Sava Quay, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
7a, Савски насип, Sava Quay, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: PIETRA PIZZERIA & COCKTAIL BAR
Review: This place really excels in the pizza and cocktail categories. The pizza masters have received numerous awards, and their commitment to Neapolitan pizza is reflected in the perfect dough prepared according to the original recipe. You can start the day with scrambled eggs on pizza dough, and then choose from over 20 specially prepared pizza combinations, from classics such as Margherita and Marinara or Decadent pizza with mangalitsa prosciutto, gorgonzola and truffles, and a vegetarian Primavera pizza with artichokes. A lengthy list of 30 cocktails has been carefully created. Veneziano with prosecco, exotic Jungle Bird and the classics such as Gin Tonic, Manhattan and Bloody Mary.

Title: TAURUNUM POGLED PIZZA BAR
Review: This restaurant is a hidden pearl of Zemun with an incredible view of the Danube and the giant poplar trees. Pizzas are prepared in wood- fired pizza ovens. There are almost 30 different flavor combinations on the menu, from classic to those with a Serbian flavor such as Grande Serbia with garlic, bacon, and kajmak. Pizza specialties of the house are Taurunum and Bresaola. In addition to pizzas, the menu has an interesting offer for breakfast, followed by bruschetta, risotto, pasta, sandwiches, and a salad meal. Serbian specialties are represented by ćevapi on kajmak, sausages and pork ribs. Homemade craft beers go well with every bite. For dessert, we recommend tres leches cake or pancakes gratinated in royal sauce.

OSM.display_name: 30, Sindjeliceva, Gardoš, Zemun, Zemun Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11080, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN MADERA
Review: The extremely professional and capable staff of Madera will make you feel like you’re visiting close friends. Be sure to listen to the advice on which rakija will whet your appetite and be sure to ask about the wine selection, because the menu is impressive. We recommend the homemade chicken pâté with black truffles and fried dough. An excellent creamy pâté with a gentle aroma of truffles, combined with fried dough that is crunchy and soft at the same time. Of the other appetizers, of which there are plenty, we suggest a variety of home-style snacks, then pearls of European cuisine such as goose liver terrine, steak tartare, or smoked salmon terrine. They also offer creamy soups and homemade soups with dumplings or homemade noodles, just like at grandma’s. They are followed by the classics from the grill and the classics of the restaurant itself. From excellent Karađorđe schnitzel, to grilled pork medallions with mushroom sauce and, of course, the star of Madera’s menu, the famous lamb kapama with sour milk that is served on Sundays. You should not skip some of the specialties such as duck breast on green pea puree, duck cracklings, or sous vide lamb shank, which practically melts in every bite, followed by river and sea fish, as well as seafood, among which we highlight the excellent octopus served with beetroot puree. The octopus, crispy and creamy at the same time, together with the contrast of the pink puree presents an exquisite artistic delight.

OSM.display_name: 43, King Alexander Boulevard, Крунски венац, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: DRUGA PIAZZA
Review: The restaurant has two spacious levels and a garden on warm days. The Bruchetteria section opens the menu, and there are classic bruschetta with tomatoes and mozzarella, powerful Friuli meat rhapsodies, and juicy bruschetta with wild mushrooms and truffle oil. There are melanzane and grilled Miroč cheese, followed by the Salumeria selection of delicacies, and Antipasto Freddo with several splendid salads and two intriguing tartares – tuna with flavored orange and pistachios, and steak with truffle oil, Piran salt and Ligurian olive tapenade. Wood–fired pizza oven is in the central part of the restaurant - you must try one of the combinations on the dough of perfect thickness. The offer goes from focaccia with prosciutto to Bresaola and Dassi with Italian prosciutto and Mortadella with pistachio cream. The meat & fish section is divided into two segments – Italy, the classics in our way, which represents all famous Italian specialties, and Carni locali, where there are attractive pork bbq ribs, artisanal sausage, and Verde steak. The meat from the Mibrasa charcoal oven is the finest steaks such as Japanese Wagyu, black Angus, and st. George’s lamb. The menu also includes pastas, and all of this is harmoniously accompanied by a wine list dominated by labels from Italy and Serbia. Harmonious Tricolore combination of mousses, great alpine apple cake, lemon tart, or interesting tiramisu with hazelnut sweetly and convincingly confirm that Piazza is an excellent choice for Italian cuisine.

Title: RESTORAN TABOR
Review: This year Tabor is celebrating 40 years of serving lovers of national cuisine. When you are near Cvetkova pijaca and a rather chaotic intersection, you have arrived to Tabor and, as soon as you enter the restaurant, you will forget about the unattractive surroundings. You will immediately be disarmed by the charm of the tucked–away space, as well as by the friendly staff. From excellent soups that will warm your stomach, and a good selection of rakijas that will warm your soul, get ready for a hearty, homely meal. Warning – their bread is fantastic, warm, and soft with a crispy crust. Leave room for what’s yet to come. Bacon–wrapped prunes, steak tartare, or parmesan– crusted chicken liver pâté are excellent preludes. If you are in the mood for grilled classics – Tabor pljeskavica with Pirot cheese, fresh chili pepper, onion, and kajmak is highly recommended, and grilled ćevapi with urnebes, as well as gourmet uštipci, are not far behind. If you’re in the mood to cook, that’s possible too! You can order a steak on a hot volcanic stone and finish it yourself at the table. Pork shin with mlinci, as well as boned pork with crispy skin, are highly recommended. However, you will certainly remember the pork cheeks for the longest time – slow cooked, and tender, in their own sauce, and served with mashed potatoes and roasted carrots, they will not leave you indifferent. In the enviable list of desserts, you will surely find a taste that will sweeten the ending.

Title: KONOBA KOD GOCE I RENATA
Review: On the very bank of the river, next to the Pančevo bridge, the konoba Kod Goce i Renata is a good destination to escape from the hustle and bustle of the city, as it is equally close to Belgrade and Pančevo. The large, rustically decorated garden and the beautiful interior are a pleasant environment and being on the riverbank and overlooking the city across the river give everything an extra relaxing touch. A rich and mildly spicy fish broth is a must for starters, and fish pâté and crispy zucchini fried in panko breadcrumbs that arrive on a large wooden board stand out as appetizers. Furthermore, you need to decide whether you prefer fish, river or sea, or meat specialties. The fish is prepared in the disc or on grill - ask what is fresh from the catch. We tried delicious sterlet, which is not always available, there are also perch, carp, and catfish. Along with river fish, sea bream and sea bass represent the sea beautifully. Grilled squid is the dish they are famous for, which was confirmed when we tried it. Spaghetti with seafood worthily represents the pasta section, which also includes spaghetti with shrimps and pasta with prawns and parmesan cheese. In that part of the menu, there are black, red, and white risottos, and the vegan menu is separated. If you’re into meat, everything is here, from grilled specialties to Karađorđe steak and beef steak. Tres leches, baklava, and tulumba are suggestions for the end, to nicely round off the whole atmosphere by the Danube River.

OSM.display_name: Панчевачки пут, Reva, Palilula, Palilula Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11060, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN CUOCO
Review: Cuoco offers juicy sandwiches, rich frittatas with mozzarella, ham and vegetables, and Italian French toast, and 25 types of pizza, from the classic Margherita to pizza with steak strips or porcini mushrooms. Particularly popular is the pizza by the meter, which combines three pizzas from the menu. Pastas and risotto are among the favorite choices, and for meat lovers they have juicy turkey Saltimbocca and veal in a parmesan crust. The dessert section is dominated by tiramisu, but also cakes with chocolate, cheese, or fruit. The restaurant is always full, especially on weekends when people come here to enjoy the flavors of Italy and the relaxed atmosphere.

OSM.display_name: Restoran Cuoco, 250, King Alexander Boulevard, МЗ Липов лад, Београд (Звездара), Zvezdara Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN ČAJKOVSKI
Review: The former Kafana Moskva, and today the Čajkovski restaurant, is one of those places that, with its many years of presence on the hospitality scene, left a historical mark on Belgrade and on all the people who have passed through them. A place full of stories, visited by historical figures and everyday people in search of a simple chat, as well as the famous Moskva šnit cake, which is certainly one of the most famous Belgrade hotel rituals of many generations. Under the leadership of its new Chef, the Čajkovski restaurant has recognized in the right way some of the important catering trends, above all the importance of the origin of ingredients and promoting their local geographical features. The menu offers goat‘s milk cheese from the village of Gunjaci, or đubek, a cheese made from steamed dough, originating from the dairy school in Pirot. We welcome this because relying on the quality of the food, which cannot exist without a relationship to the origin, together with culinary knowledge and techniques, is the only real solution for quality food. The menu also includes international specialties from Italy, Greece and France framed in an original, mature, and meaningful concept of the capital‘s hotel restaurant. With the sounds of a concert piano, you will enjoy quality service and good food at one of the most central locations in Belgrade.

Title: GIULIA
Address: Bulevar Vudroa Vilsona 12, TC Galerija, 11000 Beograd
Review: If you want to feel a touch of authentic Italy in the heart of Belgrade, the Gallo Nero restaurant is the right choice for you. It is located in the center of the city, with a hidden patio and elegant interior with carefully selected furniture and decorations. Be completely spoiled by the gastronomic offer of food and drinks in this restaurant. Start your adventure with light starters, such as aromatized prawns with Taggiasca olives and capers on polenta, or Coquille St Jacques with parmesan and artichokes. One of the creatively designed salads or traditional Italian soups can be your next step of pleasure. For full enjoyment, there are the best pieces of meat and fish such as Angus steak in Barolo red wine sauce with mashed potato and caramelized red onion, veal steak medallions in black truffle sauce with homemade gnocchi, or salmon and asparagus on lemon cream. The premium selection of dishes is accompanied by meticulously selected wines from the Apennine peninsula and a top selection of domestic and foreign spirits. Don’t forget to leave room for dessert and a good espresso, because the pleasure is not complete before you taste the rhapsody of flavors of the pistachio-raspberry cake or the chocolate decadence. For a moment, you will wonder who needs a trip to Italy when its selected flavors can be tasted right at Gallo Nero.

Title: RESTORAN ORAŠAC
Review: Located in one of the busiest boulevards in the city, with its rustic ambience, Orašac takes the typical Serbian kafana to bygone times. Right from the door, you will experience the spirit of Serbian hospitality, with some of the best local rakija, carefully selected and served in traditional čokanj. Whether you want to warm up near the large fireplace in the winter or enjoy the garden under the shade of linden trees during the summer months, you will certainly feel comfortable and welcome. Once you‘re nicely settled, the gourmet adventure can begin. Start lightly with the Orašac cheese plate with the delicate aromas of kajmak and young cheese are paired with strong Sjenica cheese and crispy peppers fermented in sour cream, the flavors of which combine irresistibly with homemade, freshly baked bread or prosciutto. As all this does not go without a special meat moment, be sure to save room to try breaded tripes or beef brain, as a true delicacy. After you wake up your palate, it‘s time for some of the typical Serbian cooked dishes – calf‘s head tripe stew or beef in soup with vegetables and horseradish. If all this is not enough to satisfy your appetite, continue to slow cooked lamb with potatoes or one of the great executions of the grill master – rolled ćevapi or grilled kumčići. Finally, treat yourself with Tito‘s vanilla slice or Bata‘s baklava with poppy seeds.

OSM.display_name: Орашац, 122, King Alexander Boulevard, Крунски венац, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
122a, King Alexander Boulevard, Крунски венац, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN & SUSHI BAR BIZU
Review: Bizu has long been known as a favorite place for sushi lovers, but the charms of its cuisine do not end there. Friendly staff will welcome you here, where you can really hide from the rest of the world and indulge in the top flavors of the Far East. As you browse the colorful menu, be sure to order the Crispy Edamame first, a special twist on the famous Japanese classic. Each edamame is individually fried in tempura and seasoned with truffle oil. If you decide to have a lighter meal, there is an excellent meal of Wakame King Crab salad or Quinoa Edamame salad. The kitchen offers four excellent tartares –tuna, salmon, steak, and sea bass, and you can modify the spiciness in agreement with the waiter. Once you‘ve chosen your flavor, they‘ll serve it on buckwheat bread, or nori seaweed in tempura we can recommend. In addition to excellent gyoza and spring rolls, there is a wide selection of noodles, wok combinations, and various tempura specialties. Whether you are in the mood for fish or meat, the choice will not leave you indifferent. Tuna in several ways, we single out tuna in pepper, or the European– Asian mix: Tuna Wellington. There are also variations on the theme in Teriyaki sauce, as well as excellent steaks and T-bone steaks. You can combine all this with a truly excellent selection of wines and very drinkable Asian beers. If there is room for dessert – their bayaderes are famous for a reason.

OSM.display_name: Андре Николића, МЗ Топчидерско брдо-Сењак, Београд (Савски венац), Savski Venac Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11115, Serbia

Title: VINOTEKA NEIMAR BAR & SHOP
Review: In the picturesque part of Neimar, there is a small oasis for lovers of wine and fine alcoholic beverages. This wine bar and shop offers over 300 different wine labels, as well as homemade rakija, whiskey, gin, vodka, and cognac. What makes this place special is their regularly rotating selection of labels that can be tasted by the glass. Each wine or drink is accompanied by carefully selected cheeses and prosciuttos. A real feeling of warmth and hospitality accompanies you throughout your stay, whether you are sitting at the community table or in the garden. The wine shop in Neimar has become indispensable for relaxing after a hard day‘s work or exploring the city.

OSM.display_name: Браничевска, Neimar, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
