Bore Stankovica, Крунски венац, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN & KOKTEL BAR ANGRY MONK
Review: The inscription on the entrance of the Angry Monk reads Cocktail lab and food temple. Start your gastronomic experience with a specially designed cocktail, and our recommendation is Is it Safe, which arrives on the table on fire, a visually entertaining experience. While the emphasis is definitely on outstanding sushi, don‘t stop there. Baked cauliflower florets, which are set against crispy puffed rice in a bowl, topped with basil and mint crisps and garnished with flowers, are truly a spectacle for all the senses. Add tuna tataki on beetroot tartare to that, and your gastronomic journey will be on the right track. The ramen looks like it came straight from a Japanese restaurant. A truly umami experience. If you‘re in the mood for something more substantial, try the pork ribs in Asian BBQ sauce, served on a perfect savory sweet potato croquette. This dish is served with a small meat cleaver, which you can easily use to cut the leaves of meat that practically melts in your mouth. If by some chance there is room left, be sure to round off the meal with an oat pie – Crack Pie, a symphony of sweet and salty, crunchy and creamy and buttery. The entire experience is rounded off by an impeccably professional and friendly staff who will be happy to advise and guide you through this Asian journey.

OSM.display_name: 11, Uzun Mirkova, Косанчићев венац, Old Town, Stari Grad Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: KAFE POSLASTIČARNICA FINI
Review: The elegant patisserie in a quiet Dorćol street is an oasis for all lovers of fine delicacies and authentic tastes of European sweets. They have a lavish selection of delicacies inspired by French tradition: they make macarons in more than 20 flavors and shapes, as well as croissants, creamy eclairs and Paris–Brest, tarts with lemon or chocolate, and frangipane... In addition to a sweet journey through France, they also offer European cakes – Sacher or Dobos torte, pies and biscuits, as well as gluten–free cakes and vegan treats. For those who prefer savory, we recommend pastries, quiche, or focaccia. Carefully selected details create a pleasant atmosphere, and in warmer days, the patio will add to your pleasure.

OSM.display_name: Svetozara Miletica, Kalvarija, Zemun, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN & KOKTEL BAR JOSEPHINE
Review: The refinement and elegance of the decadent art deco style, which takes us back to the 1920’s and the time of dazzling interiors, is perfectly connected with the spirit of modernity in the restaurant that bears the name of the most celebrated French performer of American origin. Located on the busy Slavija Square, yet far away from the hustle and bustle, Josephine certainly boasts a lot – from special attention to every detail, one of the most beautiful green patios–oases in the city, and a superb selection of wines and spirits of all kinds. Understandingly, their gastronomic offer is equally impressive. From the first taste of a warm-up bites, such as finely chopped roast pork with avocado, radishes, and fresh herbs in a homemade tortilla whose gourmet aromas blend into a perfect unity or, on the other hand, crispy spring rolls with a rich filling of Mangalitsa prosciutto, cheddar cheese and asparagus, it is clear that pleasure is abundant here. They also serve their trademark dishes, such as the lightly stewed milky veal on polenta - the softness and the juiciness evoke the deepest enjoyment, or the excellent pork tam tam – a marbled piece of boned meat, bayadere style, with homemade puree, grilled spring onions and aromatic raspberry jam with a hint of truffle. For a sense of gastronomic art, you should try the seductive pistachio cake on white chocolate with raspberry gel and ice cream or, perhaps, the homemade apple pie with vanilla sauce. Play the game of hedonism, just like Josephine once did.

OSM.display_name: Josephine, 33, Kralja Milutina, Крунски венац, Vracar, Vracar Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN SPLAV SUVENIR
Review: There are a few restaurants in Serbia that first successfully mastered a certain aspect of catering, and then earned a master’s degree and a doctorate in that field. Suvenir is one of them, with a unique atmosphere that they carefully nurture. Whenever you find yourself near the Sava River, you will enjoy the idyllic atmosphere at Suvenir. The morning winter sun, the fire in the fireplace in the evening and the perfect lighting or enjoying the patio in summer will make you happy just for being there. The extremely professional staff is friendly and enthusiastic, they have certainly mastered the topic of service. The menu is expertly designed and precisely meets the needs of their clientele, while a lot of effort has been put into the dining experience itself. Carts with hot, huge homemade bread that has just come out from under the sač, cut in front of guests, and waiters cleaning fish on carts or removing bones from delicious roast pork, contribute to the pleasant atmosphere and the feeling that every guest is important. An excellent and extensive wine list, a sufficient number of wines by the glass, and a good recommendation by the waiter will make the wine experience equally high quality. The offer includes specialties such as stuffed Suvenir fillet, ribs with shiitake mushrooms, a large selection of Adriatic fish and seafood, as well as a serious section with river fish. You won’t go wrong no matter what you choose from the main menu or desserts.

Title: RESTORAN COMUNALE
Review: Comunale is one of the trademarks of Beton Hall, a popular Belgrade destination for both gourmets and party lovers. With minimalism in the interior, with an accent on Mediterranean–Italian cuisine, and a meticulous selection of drinks, this restaurant offers a very interesting experience. To whet your appetite, you can start with a rich selection of premium Italian delicacies and cheeses, bruschetta with grilled peppers and goat cheese, or with truffles and porcini mushrooms. If you prefer a lighter option, we recommend one of the great, exotic salads, such as the one with octopus or vegetables, red quinoa, mint, and lamb‘s lettuce. There is also no mistake with homemade pastas and gnocchi, whether you opt for meat – pljukanci with steak, fish – pasta with prawns, zucchini and saffron, or vegetarian – tagliolini alla norma with cherry tomatoes, eggplant, mozzarella and rocket. Followed by focaccia, pizza, then meat or fish from the Josper oven with an unforgettable, smoky taste and smell. Grilled wild salmon or chicken fillet with cauliflower puree are a must try. Finally, sweeten the adventure with a gluten–free triple chocolate cake, soufflé, or flan with fruit and vanilla cream.

Title: MIG - MARGHERITA & GELATO
Review: MIG is the place to enjoy Neapolitan-style pizza, a meal of salads, sandwiches, and creamy Italian ice cream. In the modern interior, the epicenter is dedicated to the preparation of dough and the filling of pizzas and sandwiches. Margherita pizza is the queen, but innovative combinations such as Mortadella and pistachio, where pistachios of different textures combine perfectly with mozzarella and mortadella, are also popular, as is the rich pizza Tartufata. The basis of the sandwiches is fresh and fragrant bread, which is paired with the highest quality Serbian and Italian cheeses and cured meat products, and you can create the combinations yourself. For the perfect end to a meal, creamy Italian ice cream, ricotta, raspberry and pistachio, ferrero or almond fig.

Title: NACIONALNI RESTORAN BELA REKA
Review: The keeper of traditional flavors with a touch of modernity, in a spacious and elegant environment in green and earthy tones, Bela reka guides every guest through the rich flavors offered by our country. As with any true host, this restaurant uses exclusively home- grown food, either from their farm in the Homolje mountains valley, famous for its Gramina cheeses, or from other reliable farmers. At the beginning, play with the senses with dishes saved from oblivion, such as cicvara, where the notes of cornmeal, cow’s cheese, kajmak and butter flow into the harmony of flavors. A good combination is the calorie bomb, finely grilled pieces of steak in a crispy fried roll, topped with a gentle pumpkin seed sauce, to balance and raise the taste by an octave. When your expectations are at their peak, try an authentic symphony of softness, crispiness, sweet and salty sensations in masterfully prepared duck drumstick with homemade maple syrup. With a light pea and potato puree, every bite will bring you back to your childhood, to your grandmother’s kitchen. And just like at grandma’s, soft home-made vanilice or orasnice are waiting for you at the end. A careful selection of local wines and beers will contribute to an unforgettable taste. If you want to take home a piece of this magic, you can also do so if you visit the local delicatessen shop in the restaurant.

OSM.display_name: Thule Shop, 179, Тошин бунар, Mladost, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11070, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN L’ADRESSE
Address: Svetog Save 10, Saint Ten Hotel, 11000 Beograd
Review: Allow the extremely friendly staff to accommodate you, rouse your appetite with an aperitif or a glass of sparkling wine and go through the menu carefully. Whether you warm up with the excellent consommé served before you, or whether you opt for colder yet equally good dishes, such as steak tartare, sea bass ceviche or raw tuna served on crispy rice with vegetables marinated in Szechuan sauce, you will have a very high–quality gourmet experience. It will be hard to choose between a carefully selected piece of meat such as Iberico Pluma de Ballota, dry aged T–bone, rib eye, tuna steak or for a carefully prepared specialty such as perfectly roasted Hoisin duck combined with a very potent Hoisin sauce and served on sweet and savory carrot and anise puree or, perhaps, slow–roasted veal with wild mushrooms that will melt in your mouth with every bite. Add to all this the excellent, handmade egg pasta served in various varieties and the excellent kumquat risotto that brings together several flavors and textures in a very daring way. Get ready for sweet torment. Speaking of sweets, you must not leave this restaurant without trying the wild raspberry truffle. It is a sumptuous, buttery, and creamy chocolate cake, enriched with truffles and topped with a sauce that is basically the essence of raspberries.

Title: RESTORAN PINOT
Review: One comes to Pinot for the wine and stays for the food! The wine list has been selected with great care and offers a truly impressive selection of classics, rarities and hidden pearls from the region and the world. There is also a wide selection of wines by the glass, so don’t hesitate to try a few types before choosing a bottle to accompany your meal. The extremely friendly and very well–trained staff will be happy to discuss your wine preferences with you before helping you choose the right wine, but also the right dish that will go best with that wine. It is recommended to start with the classics. Foie gras and pineapple and chili chutney on brioche bread is a vivacious bite that plays with spicy and sweet, creamy, and crunchy, hot and cold. Steak tartare or prawn tartare are also good choices. Bao buns are a slightly more modern alternative, whether they are made with duck confit or pork, wittily named Vlach Magic, you won’t go wrong. The menu is not extensive, but it is fun and substantial. There is a selection of steaks in which the parmesan and pistachio–crusted steak stands out, as well as the aged rib eye. We recommend the extremely soft beef cheeks in red wine sauce, served on a creamy chestnut puree, with discreet notes of cinnamon and nutmeg. Duck drumsticks and tequila–flambéed prawns are also an excellent choice.

OSM.display_name: 86ž, Омладинских бригада, Mladost, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia
86z, Омладинских бригада, Mladost, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: TORO LATIN GASTROBAR
Review: Toro Latin Gastrobar offers a fusion of Latin cuisine and Asian gastronomic trends. In addition to a selection of very carefully served fusions of the flavors of these two cuisines, they also make excellent cocktails, as well as a well selected wine list, mostly based on the region. This restaurant is also known for its very generous and delicious breakfast they serve on weekends, when you can try almost everything from the rich breakfast offer at a very reasonable price. Our recommendation is not to miss the steak tartare prepared with a special Latin twist. Namely, in addition to crushed Brazil nuts, marinated jalapeño peppers are added to the steak, which bring a special piquancy and freshness to this classic. An additional plus is that they combine it as a special show at your table. The interesting series continues with the specialties they named Suviche (a combination of Latin seviche and Asian sushi). Among the hot appetizers, Firework prawns in crispy tempura, which are then tucked in spicy mayonnaise, stand out. Whether you’re into tacos or grilled meat, Toro won’t let you down. For lovers of quality meat, Toro Steak, black angus tomahawk or dry aged rib eye are excellent choices. Don’t skip the excellent roasted peppers that are additionally enriched with cashew aioli and sweetened with passion fruit glaze! They accompany the perfectly prepared pieces of meat from the grill in a fantastic way. If you’re after dessert, their version of Tres Leches is excellent, while La Bomba is an unforgettable experience!

Title: TISA NEW BALKAN CUISINE
Review: The New Balkan Cuisine concept, with the Tisa restaurant as its newest member, was developed by Vanja Puškar, a virtuoso of the Serbian gourmet scene, and has already established itself as a place of recognizable cuisine that we always happily return to. As with all success stories, the principles behind the concept are extremely simple – the redesign of Balkan cuisine, the use of ingredients specific to the climate and cooperation with local producers. With creative ideas and combinations, a new form of classics on a plate was created, and enjoyment is guaranteed. Important segments of this story are the ambience, which is simple, reduced, with a touch of minimalism but not cold, as well as the staff, who are extremely pleasant and friendly with their guests. Just reading the menu will delight you with the excellent combination of ingredients and you will have a serious dilemma about what to order, because you will want to try everything. It doesn’t matter which of the great appetizers you choose, because enjoyment is guaranteed no matter what you decide on – crispy buckwheat flour rolls with young cheese, honey and caramelized walnuts, juicy pork leg croquettes with cream of fresh lemon and chives, Ljutenica, mustard greens and horseradish or maybe a mini–bun with lamb, tomato salsa or olives and marinated cucumber. The impression is the same with the main specialties on the menu – pork on the side, juicy lamb, veal ribs with deep fried urnebes ball, and Istrian pasta with Mangalitsa lard and truffles. The end is sweetest with a chocolate cake with black truffle or a baked tart with prunes.

OSM.display_name: Bulevar Plaza, 129, King Alexander Boulevard, МЗ Вуков споменик, Београд (Звездара), Zvezdara Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: THYME – STREET FOOD&BREAKFAST
Review: In a small street food place in Zemun, a team of young, talented chefs shows their version of fast food. There are several types of burgers, from classics to Asian–inspired ones. The umami burger made from slow–roasted duck stands out. Then there are Thyme versions of falafel, beef kebabs and soft bao buns. They use fresh ingredients, and the menu follows the seasons and at the same time promotes local ingredients such as Karakachan lamb. The juicy and soft meat is wonderfully combined with young cabbage, mascarpone with bear‘s garlic and caramelized pistachios. Among the desserts, chocolate reforma parfait with hazelnut crunch and warm chocolate sauce and tart with seasonal ingredients stand out. The creative approach to street food makes this place special.

OSM.display_name: 4b, Karadjordjeva, Ретензија, Zemun, Zemun Urban Municipality, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN RODIZIO
Review: The spirit of Latin American haciendas, with aged, first–class cuts of meat and the exceptional way of their preparation, serving and presentation. All this was transferred to the business district of New Belgrade and makes the offer of the Rodizio restaurant. A luxurious and modernly equipped ambience, with ranch motifs, and wine and meat showcase, as well as friendly and well–coordinated staff tell you that you are in for a treat right from the first impression. Make yourself comfortable and order some good red wine. It is recommended not to skip the one from South Africa, so the tasting can begin. You choose whether you will try meat aged for 25, 50 or 90 days, and whether you will choose t–bone steak, tomahawk, porterhouse, or classic steak. For a dose of luxury, season the meat with gold flakes, and for a real rhapsody of taste, there is a jewel in the offer – picanha, the juiciest piece of marbled beef. If you have a voracious appetite and are ready for a meat earthquake, the specialty of the house – Rodizio grill or a selection of 11 different types of meat – is a must. Pleasure is not only for the palate but also for the eye, because Rodizio grill is served in a special way. Well-trained waiters, cortadores, use a large sword to chop pieces of meat in front of you and serve them in a well–coordinated rhythm from several small portions, ensuring that each bite preserves the perfect juiciness and temperature. If all this was not sweet enough, at the end there is a premium cake or a portion of churros.

OSM.display_name: 11b, Милутина Миланковића, Old Airport, New Belgrade, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11070, Serbia

Title: OSTERIA MOZZARELLA
Address: Uroša Martinovića 31, A blok, 11073 Novi Beograd
Review: The cute restaurant Osteria Mozzarela takes you on a gastronomic adventure with the most beautiful flavors of Italy begins with an unusual gourmet route along all the Italian regions. If we start from Piedmont, try the Italian French toast, or veal medallions, and have the cake with three types of milk for dessert. Lombardy will tempt you with the aromas of green risotto with turkey, or gnocchi with zucchini and salmon in the Italian way, and the sweet magic is in the authentic cheesecake. The sounds of the waves washing the coast are in the flavors of Liguria with the typical aromas of calamari in tomato sauce, or Livorno octopus. Magical Tuscany will bare its soul to us with pork neck on beans, veal tagliata or homemade profiteroles with chocolate. Of course, all roads lead to Rome and the Lazio region with classics, such as delicious soft-crispy turkey saltimbocca, turkey salad or prawns in white sauce. It wouldn’t be Italy without Campania and its phenomenal selection of pizzas. Finally, you can sail to the romantic south, to Sicily and treat yourself to a traditional breakfast, mortadella-pistachio pizza, or Sicilian cannoli. And this is just a peek at discovering the regions of Italy and their characteristic flavors.

OSM.display_name: Уроша Мартиновића, Sava Quay, A Block, New Belgrade Urban Municipality, Belgrade, City of Belgrade, Central Serbia, 11000, Serbia

Title: RESTORAN NOVAK 1
Review: In two Belgrade locations, Novi Beograd and Dorćol, Novak restaurants offer a delightful gastronomic experience that conveniently combines international cuisine with some of the classics. The dedication to one of the world’s greatest athletes is in details and features, while current sports events are often displayed on the screens. The menu opens with two interesting vegan creations, a rich panko breaded vegetarian steak and vegetable noodles with tofu cheese. If you want to stay on home turf, check what’s on Table D’hôte and try the excellent grilled cheese rskavac, served with tobacco cracklings and ajvar. There are also uštipci gratinated with roasted peppers and kajmak, traditional pljeskavica with onion and sausage with cheese. Furthermore - burritos with chicken or well- prepared grilled turkey with fine hazelnut sauce, tortilla rolls with spinach and spicy risotto, and we recommend that you try baked pasta. Choose the main ingredient - chicken, turkey or salmon, and enjoy. The portion is generous and tasty, and it is the right choice for a larger group. The main part of the menu includes rump steak with caramelized onions and feta cheese, pepper steak, and steak with enchilada. In the fish section, we recommend tuna and salmon steak, grilled squid, and sea bass with sauteed vegetables. Along with a large selection of pancakes, the absolute favorite among the delicacies is the unusual cake with an unusual name, Vatrena ljubav, with a perfect balance of textures, cream, and fruit.

Title: HOMA
Address: Žorža Klemansoa 19, ugao Senjanina Ive i Dositejeve, 11000 Beograd
Review: If you are visiting Homa for the first time, enjoy the inconspicuous interior, minimalism in the style and decoration of the space, and the isolated and unexpected location of the restaurant, in Dorćol. However, expect hedonism, creativity of the author’s kitchen and great flavors that change seasonally that go to the maximum. With soft music playing in the background, while tasting one of the top wines from the carefully selected national or international sommelier’s offer, start the rhapsody of flavors with a creatively served beef tail consommé with a vurda dumpling, or a seductive cuttlefish ragout with homemade pasta, cuttlefish ink and saffron. Even the lighter flavors carry notes of the unexpected, like the imaginative watermelon, goat cheese and pistachio salad. Or endive salad with caramelized seeds, hummus with red currants, and a tahini and soy dressing. And just when you think it can’t get any better, you will be impressed once again, with a piece of rump steak aged for 60 days with a side dish of grilled Jerusalem artichoke, porcini mushrooms and hollandaise sauce. Finally, the sweets are the culmination of pleasure like baklava with pine nuts with the addition of candied orange sabayon and pear sorbet. The ingredients are ingenious, the prudent combination is perfect, and the taste sensation is lasting. Homa is the place for explorers.

Title: RESTORAN METROPOLITAN
Review: The unpretentious and pleasant Metropolitan restaurant offers food for different tastes. Before you dive into the vivid main courses, don’t deny yourself one of the very special appetizers. In fact, almost every dish from this kitchen comes served in carefully selected crockery and is served in such a way that you might hesitate as to whether to spoil the visual harmony before you. All those thoughts fall into oblivion after the first bite, as you indulge in pure pleasure. Whether you started with tuna crudo on spicy avocado puree, where the textures of avocado and tuna complement each other in a fun way, or with classic hummus additionally enriched with shiitake mushrooms and served with homemade pita bread, or you opt for a carefully selected selection of cheeses and dried meat products from Kosmaj, you can’t go wrong. You can continue in the traditional manner – with excellent homemade sarma served on excellent potato puree, or ćevapi, and you can also switch to some of the specialties of world cuisine. Slow cooked veal cheeks will keep you coming back to this restaurant. Served on an exquisite saffron risotto, the cooked meat is in Port wine sauce, and enriched with goose pâté, tomato jam and fresh truffles. Words can truly not describe how good it is.

Title: KOORDINATA STREET RESTORAN
Review: At Koordinata, dishes are carefully designed and seasonal. The basis is fresh ingredients; they also produce the preserves and part of the fresh products. In each unique and unforgettable bite, you can feel the love for every aspect of food preparation and serving. A dish that guests praise and that is always on the menu is the chicken liver inspired by the legendary chef Anthony Bourdain, served with fantastic homemade brioche bread. Depending on the season, there is lasagna from homemade pasta, focaccia with rosemary and garlic, duck, octopus, homemade ice cream and cakes inspired by childhood. Along with the food, special attention is paid to the wine list.

Title: RESTORAN MEZE BY ELLINIKO
Review: The blue and white tones of the interior from the moment you enter suggest that you are in an authentic Greek restaurant. Many tables, an open kitchen and busy waiters will make you feel the breath and spirit of the Mediterranean. Start enjoying the flavors of Greece with salads with feta and halloumi cheeses, dishes with eggplant, a diverse selection of tasty snacks such as spinach pie, fava beans and green salad. Main dishes include everything you would expect from the flavors of Greek cuisine – moussaka, souvlaki, kofta, or fish and seafood. Special attention is paid to original ingredients, so there are cheeses with protected geographical origin, as well as olives and spices. A rich selection of Greek wines is there to complement the meal, and the staff is available for recommendations and suggestions.

Title: KOLO BISTROT BALKANIQUE
Address: Bulevar Vudroa Vilsona 12, TC Galerija, 11000 Beograd
Review: Located in the Galerija shopping mall, Kolo captivates with its unusual design that harmoniously combines traditional symbols with modern details. They also have a garden along the Sava River Promenade, and a view of the open kitchen. The attractive bistrot Balkanique concept is consistently implemented in the interior design, on the menu and on the plates. Although the location calls for it, Kolo is not only a place to take a break from shopping, but it is also inspiring enough to visit this particular restaurant. You can read on the paper coasters how the kolo dance was created, and what are the key details of Serbian folklore. The famous Pirot đubek is served in a pan, sprinkled with cracklings, and roasted hazelnuts, and we suggest as an ideal pair for this specialty veal rolls with roasted peppers, arugula, and cheese mousse, topped with spicy sauce. The main part brings the expected intense flavors, so we tried beef shin au gratin with soft dough crust with carrots, potatoes and kajmak, a dish for which you won’t need a knife. The ubiquitous truffles appear here in the company of a pljeskavica on pita bread, with pickled onions and pickles that give a good balance to this unusual combination of flavors. They also offer Homolje lamb, game sausages, pork ribs and Mangalica neck. In the sweet part, Kolo skillfully expands and successfully plays beyond the limits, so both Paris brest and Pavlova served in a glass with lots of fruit left an excellent impression.

Title: PRETOP – BREAD&SCHWEIN&CHAMPAGNE
Review: The unique restaurant on the Zemun farmers market raised to heights the bold composition of roasted pig, sparkling wine, and homemade bread. The menu is short and effective. Pork bayadere, that is, a juicy boned pork roast with a perfectly crispy crust that arrives with the obligatory pretop, roast drippings to dip homemade sourdough bread in. Coleslaw and horseradish go with the meat and bread. Sparkling wines and champagne go perfectly with their roasts. Labels are carefully selected, and the selection is regularly refreshed. The enthusiastic team continuously adds new items, such as burek, focaccia or pork pizza, which are available on particular days.

Title: MEHURIĆ CHAMPAGNE&BAR
Address: Ilije Garašanina 5a, Palilulska pijaca lok. 45, 11000 Beograd
Review: What makes this bar special is the community that gathers here and the good atmosphere. Mehurić offers an amazing selection of champagnes and sparkling wines, and if you are a fan of classic champagne from France, Italian prosecco or sparkling wine from local wineries, you will find the perfect drink here. An interesting selection of snacks and meals from nearby restaurants goes perfectly with that. In Mehurić, you can also buy wine, along with accompanying equipment and professional advice that will help you choose the perfect bottle. If you are in the mood for a livelier atmosphere, the right place to enjoy wine bubbles and music is the Disco market, when this becomes the destination for lovers of a good time.

Title: RESTORAN THE TWENTY TWO
Address: Bulevar kralja Aleksandra 69, Hotel Metropol, 11000 Beograd
Review: This elegant restaurant is located on the roof of the Metropol Hotel and offers a breathtaking panoramic view of the city. Refined interior design, modern design, as well as professional staff who welcome you with a smile are the first impressions when you walk in. The carefully designed menu does not offer many dishes, but each one is a real small feat. In the section of cold appetizers, smoked burrata in puff pastry with Napoli sauce and Granny Smith duck confit – a seductive combination of liver, tangy apple and mushroom carpaccio stand out. Warm bites start with a somewhat surprising selection of homemade burek, but in a modern version – divided into segments with kajmak, Greek yogurt and cheese, followed by exotic shrimp and kumquat risotto, served with a side of celery, butter, zucchini and pumpkin oil. In the soup section, there is beef tea and Tuscan tomato soup. The main dish offer is the crown - such as Iberian pork steak with dark beer and a side of pie with aged cheese and potato cream or duck meat served in milk. The fish menu offers the flavors of juicy salmon in a crust or red mullet fillet with sweet corn puree. We also recommend the steaks. The coconut foam or Belgian garden with three types of chocolate and different textures are certainly a notable finale.

Title: CAMPANIA PIZZA GOURMET
Address: Omladinskih brigada 86, lokal 3d, West 65, 11070 Novi Beograd
Review: The offer of the Campania Pizza Gourmet restaurant brings a touch of the Apennines and the rich gourmet flavors of Italy. As a contrast to the strict and cold business-residential complex in which it is located, the ambiance of the restaurant exudes warmth and the welcome you will experience from the first bites, and the flavors are more than great. Start your pleasure with baked crostini in several options - with tomatoes, stewed vegetables or nduja, a spicy sausage from Calabria. There are also classics like bocconcini with ricotta and zucchini, Sicilian rice balls with vegetables and mozzarella, arancini or caponata, stewed eggplant in extra virgin olive oil sauce. All the pasta comes from Gragnano, Campania region and it is bronze-die pasta. It’s up to you to choose whether you want gnocchi with truffles, tagliatelle with several types of mushrooms, spaghetti alla putanesca or one of the pasta varieties. Save room for one of the main courses where you can expect refreshing chicken in lemon sauce, oven- braised beef meatballs with tomato sauce, salmon with vegetables baked in a wood-fired oven, or perhaps, 35–40-day aged beef steak. An excellent selection of Neapolitan pizzas prepared in a wood-fired oven is amazing. You won’t be disappointed by the desserts either, so choose from the original tiramisu, caprese cake, panna cotta or lemon ice cream sorbet. With Aperol, grappa, or good wine, you will have a full gastronomic experience of Italy.

Title: MESARA MORAVA – MEAT CONCEPT STORE
Review: The restaurant on the Palilula farmers market is an oasis for lovers of quality meat and authentic flavors. In Morava, different cuts of meat are prepared with care. From the must-have ćevapi according to the old recipe, which arrive in a soft bun, with the obligatory side dishes - creamy kajmak and onion. There is also dry aged T bone, beef carpaccio, and specialties such as beef diaphragm and bone stuffed with steak tartare are also featured on the menu. As a side dish, we recommend polenta or fries with truffles. Along with the great food, all the bites here are perfectly paired with the selected wines. A particularly cheerful atmosphere prevails at events, such as the Disco Market, which pleasantly complement and enhance the enjoyment of food and drink.

Title: BUENA VIDA MEXICAN GASTRO-BAR
Address: Bulevar Milutina Milankovića 1i, Navigator Business Center, 11070 Novi Beograd
Review: Every plate in the Buena Vida gastrobar brings the vibrant temperament of Mexico. Located in the busy Navigator business district in New Belgrade, this restaurant with an equally lively atmosphere offers its guests a handful of good flavors and spicy notes. For starters, there are hand-made guacamole versions with marinated mango, goat cheese and basil, or avocado and pico de gallo sauce. The nachos mama with sofrito beans, roasted corn and crispy tortilla chips or the nachos loco with spicy toreado peppers and macha jalapeño salsa also go well with it. In the appetizer section, don’t miss the toasted flatbread, coca, with steak carpaccio, fireworks sauce, rocket, mango, and salsa negra, or the empanadas – classic Mexican pies filled with marinated chicken filling with curry cream, salsa verdita, and cilantro. Another dish you must try is the tacos that come in a portion of three, and it’s up to you to choose an option - Americano, crispy shrimp, or those with grilled chicken. For the main dish, there are juicy Mexican BBQ ribs with grilled pineapple salsa, ranchera steak served in a nice wok sauce with jasmine rice and French fries. If you want a unified impression, there is a menu option - Flavors of Mexico where you can experience the whole world of Mexican cuisine, a combination of a little bit of everything. The dessert will only complete the adventure, so be sure to try the traditional churros or the interesting Hit Me cake.

Title: GUŠTI MORA
Review: The very name of the restaurant unequivocally hints at a sumptuous gastronomic pleasure. The authentic spirit and flavor of the Adriatic was brought and refined directly from Herceg Novi by dedicated owners who have been improving the quality of the offer for over two decades. The long wine list contributes to an exceptional experience, and the key role is played by the impressive offer of fresh fish and seafood. As an introduction to the magical world of the sea, try the aromatic sea fish pâté served with slices of butter and toasted bread, prawn tartar, crab cocktail or Njeguš prosciutto and cheese in oil. The stars of the local menu are sea bass, sea bream, sole, grouper tail, John Dory and red porgy - grilled, salted, or baked in the oven. The friendly staff will present you with the daily selection and advise you on the quantity. Perfectly grilled octopus is a powerful choice, and in combination with a mix of salads and potatoes, it gets a refreshing Mediterranean touch. Adriatic squid, grilled, fried, or stuffed, prawns on the grill, cooked (in buzara) or rolled with prosciutto, Saint Jacques scallops, or lobster, are some of the choices that you can’t go wrong with in Gušti. The excellent rich black risotto will impress you, and this section offers spaghetti and risotto with seafood, prawns, or shrimp. In the dessert section, you will find a delicious pie with sour cherries and ice cream, hazelnut parfait, tres leches cake and panna cotta.This is a place for a very special Adriatic pleasure.
